27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ea re Pompeius quid velit, non dispicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine jam aliquid dispiciam,</quote> <trans><tr>to find out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 5, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14329.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (mostly in the <hi rend="ital">imperat.</hi>), <hi rend="ital">to consider, think, reflect upon</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc velim dispicias res Romanas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">discerne et dispice insidiatorem et petitum insidiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 1:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 1, 8</bibl> pr.: <cit><quote lang="la">dispice, an tu, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:18:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dispice, ne sit, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 2:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prius dispiciamus de his, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:section=143" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, § 143</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:1:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 14, 1, 1</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus est, ubi occasio admonet, dispicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:2:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 2, 3, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dispiter: <entryFree id="n14330" type="main" key="Dispi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Dispĭter</orth>, v. Dis and Dĭespiter.</entryFree>
displano: <entryFree id="n14331" type="hapax" key="displa_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-plāno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n14331.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to level away, to level</hi>: rutro caput, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 18, 25</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
displicatus: <entryFree id="n14332" type="hapax" key="displi^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-plĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> [plico], <sense id="n14332.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">scattered, dispersed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
displicentia: <entryFree id="n14333" type="main" key="displi^centi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">displĭcentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>displiceo</etym>, <sense id="n14333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dissatisfaction, discontent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sui (with taedium),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. An. 2:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. An. 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14333.1" n="II" level="1"> Med. t. t., <hi rend="ital">indisposition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 3:6:86" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 3, 6, 86</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:5:10:96" default="NO">5, 10, 96</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
displiceo: <entryFree id="n14334" type="main" key="displi^ce^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-plĭcĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi</itype> (displicitus est, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:21:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 21, 4</bibl>), <itype>ĭtum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>placeo</etym>, <sense id="n14334.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to displease</hi> (opp. placeo and complaceo, v. 3. dis, II. —rare but class.): quodne vobis placeat, <pb n="593" /> <cb n="DISP" /> displiceat mihi? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 19</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so opp. placere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 2, 107</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 9, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortis mihi displicet auctor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:493" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 493</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">si displicebit vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 2, 19</bibl></cit>; so without <case>dat.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 21, 3</bibl> (opp. arridere); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 9, 6</bibl> (opp. placere); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 38, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 47 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non mihi displicet adhibere etiam istam rationem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:34:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 34, 157</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with a subjectclause,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:17" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14334.1" n="II" level="1"> Sibi, <hi rend="ital">to be displeased, dissatisfied with one's self</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 4, 20</bibl>; Poëta ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 18, 3</bibl>; also, <cit><quote lang="la">in gen.,</quote> <trans><tr>to feel fretful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 5, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aconitum potum protinus facit corpus grave et displicens,</quote> <trans><tr>uneasy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 188" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 188</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
displico: <entryFree id="n14335" type="main" key="displi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-plĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n14335.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to scatter</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:16:7" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 16, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
displodo: <entryFree id="n14336" type="main" key="displo_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-plōdo</orth>, no <sense id="n14336.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, ōsum, 3, <hi rend="ital">v. a., to spread out, dilate, extend</hi> (for the most part only ante- and post-class., and in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.;</hi> in class. prose not at all): <cit><quote lang="la">pedibus magnis, et altis, qui ingredienti ei displodantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:9:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 9, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 2:5:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 8</bibl>.—In the <hi rend="ital">part. perf., burst asunder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vesicula displosa repente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 131</bibl></cit>; cf. * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">repente templa caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 285</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">divolsa repente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>ib.</author> 122</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">nares,</quote> <trans><tr>spread out, broad</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, p. 108</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6</bibl>, p. 196.</sense></entryFree>
displosus: <entryFree id="n14337" type="main" key="displo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">displōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from displodo.</entryFree>
displuviata: <entryFree id="n14338" type="main" key="displu^vi^a_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">displŭvĭāta</orth> (cava aedium) sunt, in quibus deliquiae arcam sustinentes stillicidia reiciunt, i. e. <sense id="n14338.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of which the rain-water runs off on both sides of the walls</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dispolio: <entryFree id="n14339" type="main" key="dispo^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">di-spŏlĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <sense id="n14339.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to plunder, spoil utterly</hi>: templum lunae Ephesiae, Treb. Poll. Gallien. 6, 2; <cit><quote lang="la">also as var. lect. for despolio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:20:section=43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 20, § 43</bibl></cit>, v. Zumpt ad h. l.</sense></entryFree>
dispondeus: <entryFree id="n14340" type="greek" key="disponde_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">di-spondēus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">dispo/ndeios</foreign>, <sense id="n14340.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a double spondee</hi>¯¯¯¯, Diomed. p. 476 P.; Don. p. 1739 ib. et saep.</sense></entryFree>
dispono: <entryFree id="n14341" type="main" key="dispo_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-pōno</orth>, <itype>pŏsŭi, pŏsĭtum</itype> (contr. dispostum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 52</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:644" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 644</bibl>), 3, <sense id="n14341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to place here and there, to set in different places, to distribute regularly, to dispose, arrange</hi> (cf. dispenso, II.—freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n14341.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14341.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to set in order, arrange, dispose</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">libros confusos antea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 8</bibl></cit>, a; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Homeri libros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:34:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 34, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos (harundinum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:47" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 47</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">brassicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:27" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 11, 15, § 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidque suo loco,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:2:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pennas in ordine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 45</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: disjecta membra in ordinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 1257" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 1257</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obliquos ordines in quincuncem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:73:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 73, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 41</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 8, 9, § 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">male capillos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 14, 35</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">comas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Pont. 3, 3, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:83" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 83</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tectos enses per herbam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:237" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 237</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceras per atria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:591" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 591</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: expressi cera voltus singulis disponebantur armariis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 2, 2, § 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabernas deversorias per litora et ripas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cubicula plurifariam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 43</bibl></cit> et saep.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Prometheus) corpora disponens, etc., qs. arranging the parts, limbs,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>fashioning, forming</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:5:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 5, 9</bibl></cit> (4, 4, 9 M.): <cit><quote lang="la">moenia versu,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to describe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 1, 57; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:7:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 7, 64</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14341.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., milit. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to set in order, arrange, to draw up, array</hi> a body of men, a guard, military engines, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidia disponit, castella communit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">praesidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:73:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 73, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">custodias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 5, 33, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 56, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:101:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 101, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exploratores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:35:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 35, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insidias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:5:29" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 5, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:2:9:7 al" default="NO">2, 9, 7 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos,</quote> <trans><tr>to station in relays</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ballistas machinasque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:46" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 46</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">custodias in muro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 27, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 34, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">expeditos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> et saep.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones in Apulia hibernorum causa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tormenta in muris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sudes in opere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:81:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 81, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">milites iis operibus quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:21:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 21, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exploratores omni fluminis parte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:61:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 61, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classem omni ora maritima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves in litore pluribus locis separatim,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 24, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes castris praesidio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 88, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidia custodiasque ad ripas Ligeris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:55:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 55, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <cb n="DISP" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 65, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 50</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidia cis Rhenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 4, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones Narbone circumque ea loca hiemandi causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:37:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 37, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equites per oram maritimam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 24, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 111, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:5:1" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 5, 1</bibl> et saep.</sense><sense id="n14341.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba ita disponunt ut pictores varietatem colorum, paria paribus referunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of the regular arrangement of the parts of a discourse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:42:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 42, 179</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 25, 96 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:12:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 12, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:3:10" default="NO">3, 3, 10</bibl> et saep.; cf. also <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fac ut plane iis omnibus, quos devinctos tenes, descriptum ac dispositum suum cuique munus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:Pet. Cons. 5" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> Pet. Cons. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ministeria principatus in equites Romanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii curas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 16, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilia in omnem fortunam ita disposita habebat (the fig. being borrowed from milit. lang.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in disponendo die,</quote> <trans><tr>in arranging the business of the day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Polyb. 25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Polyb. 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 36</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">otium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus otiosum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:20" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus et requiem pariter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:43" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 43</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14341.5" n="B" level="2"> In post-class. lang., with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rel. clause</hi>, like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">diata/ssw</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">to settle, determine</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non alienum erit disponi, apud quem puer interim educetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:30:3:section=4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 30, 3, § 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thebani apparere paucos disposuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 3:2:10:2" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 3, 2, 10, 2</bibl></cit> (dub.): <cit><quote lang="la">excursatores quingentos sensim praeire disposuit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">24, 6, 4</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:3:18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 10, 3, 18</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dispŏsĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., regularly distributed;</hi> hence <hi rend="ital">properly ordered, arranged</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">studia ad honorem disposita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">also transf.: vir dispositus,</quote> <trans><tr>an orderly speaker</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 2:11:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 11, 17</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lumina ex disposito relucentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:de Prov. 1:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> de Prov. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: dispositius, Sen. Q. N. praef. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Ira D. 10</bibl> <hi rend="ital">med.—Sup.</hi> Boëth. Cons. Phil. 4, pros. 2.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dispŏsĭte</orth>, <hi rend="ital">orderly, methodically</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">accusare istum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:40:section=87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 40, § 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exponere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7 praef" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7 praef.</bibl></cit> § <cit><quote lang="la">18: mundus effectus est (with ordinate),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 3, 17</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedificare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dispositio: <entryFree id="n14342" type="main" key="dispo^si^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dispŏsĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dispono</etym>. <sense id="n14342.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A regular disposition, arrangement</hi>, in oratory, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:7:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:42:179" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 42, 179</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 10, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:3:1 sq" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 3, 1 sq.</bibl> et saep.; <cit><quote lang="la">in arch.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">in painting,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 10, 36, § 80</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">in milit.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> A. M. 3, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 24, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14342.1" n="II" level="1"> In post-class. lang., <hi rend="ital">management, ordering, direction</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Maxim. 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: ultima, <hi rend="ital">testamentary disposition</hi>, Cod. 6, 23, 28 prooem.</sense></entryFree>
dispositor: <entryFree id="n14343" type="main" key="dispo^si^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dispŏsĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14343.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a disposer, arranger</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundi deus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:18:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 18, 4</bibl></cit>: rerum naturae (of the <foreign lang="greek">*logos</foreign>), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 9, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dispositura: <entryFree id="n14344" type="main" key="dispo^si^tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dispŏsĭtūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14344.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a disposition, arrangement</hi>, perh. only <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:1027" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 1027</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:192" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 192</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dispositus: <entryFree id="n14345" type="main" key="dispo^si^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dispŏsĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from dispono.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n14346" type="hapax" key="dispo^si^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dispŏsĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a disposition, arrangement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dispositu civilium rerum peritus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dispudet: <entryFree id="n14347" type="main" key="dispu^det"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-pŭdet</orth>, <itype>puduit, ēre</itype>, <sense id="n14347.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. impers., to be greatly ashamed</hi> (perh. only in foll. passages): <cit><quote lang="la">alia memorare dispudet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:3:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 3, 3, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 5, 2, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 1, 16</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">genit.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non vos tot calumniarum tandem dispudet?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. 63, p. 315, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dispulsus: <entryFree id="n14348" type="main" key="dispulsus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dispulsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, v. dispello.</entryFree>
dispulvero: <entryFree id="n14349" type="hapax" key="dispulve^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-pulvĕro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n14349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. a., to reduce to powder, pulverize</hi>: saxa, etc., Naev. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 95, 28</bibl> (Com. Fragm. v. 57 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
dispunctio: <entryFree id="n14350" type="main" key="dispuncti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dispunctĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dispungo</etym>, <sense id="n14350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a settling up, balancing</hi> of accounts (late Lat.). </sense><sense id="n14350.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">concedenda creditoribus (with recognitio),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:5:15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 42, 5, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14350.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">an investigation, examination, a testing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">boni et mali operis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utriusque meriti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Apol. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>death</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Test. Anim. 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Anim. 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
dispunctor: <entryFree id="n14351" type="hapax" key="dispunctor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dispunctor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14351.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an examiner, investigator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meritorum (with judex),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 17</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dispunctus: <entryFree id="n14352" type="main" key="dispunctus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dispunctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from dispungo.</entryFree>
dispungo: <entryFree id="n14353" type="main" key="dispungo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-pungo</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> In postAug. mercant. lang., <sense id="n14353.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to check off</hi> the debits <cb n="DISP" /> and credits of an account; hence, <hi rend="ital">to examine, revise, settle, balance</hi> an account: <cit><quote lang="la">dispungere est conferre accepta et data,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:56" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 56</bibl></cit>. </sense><sense id="n14353.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationes expensorum et acceptorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:32" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostram et Julii Attici rationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:3:12" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rationes (with excutere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:7:6:section=6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 7, 6, § 6</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n14353.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dispunge et recense vitae tuae dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Brev. Vit. 7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Brev. Vit. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque quisquam elegantius intervalla negotiorum otio dispunxit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>devoted, gave up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:13:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 13, 3</bibl></cit> Ruhnk. (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">interpuncta intervalla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:16:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 16, 53</bibl></cit>): <cit><quote lang="la">elogia sententiis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to examine, weigh</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 44</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">specialis medicinae dispuncta prophetia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>tried, approved</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordinem coeptum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to bring to an end</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Jud. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
disputabilis: <entryFree id="n14354" type="hapax" key="dispu^ta_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dispŭtābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>disputo</etym>, <sense id="n14354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be disputed, disputable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnis res in utramque partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88:43" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88, 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
disputatio: <entryFree id="n14355" type="main" key="dispu^ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dispŭtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. * <sense id="n14355.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A computing, calculating, considering</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">commentatio, dissertatio): venire in disputationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Far more freq., </sense><sense id="n14355.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An arguing, reasoning, disputing;</hi> and concr., <hi rend="ital">an argument, debate, dispute</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">controversia, concertatio, altercatio, contentio, jurgium, rixa),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 36, 116</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 7</bibl> et saep.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 30, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 33, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:80" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:14" default="NO">7, 2, 14</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
disputatiuncula: <entryFree id="n14356" type="main" key="dispu^ta_ti^uncu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dispŭtātĭuncŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>disputatio</etym>, <sense id="n14356.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a short discussion, trivial dispute</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 117" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 117 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
disputativus: <entryFree id="n14357" type="main" key="dispu^ta_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dispŭtātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>disputo</etym>, <sense id="n14357.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to a dispute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">intentiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 9, 19</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dispŭtā-tīve</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in the way of discussion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dispute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere aliquid,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 5, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
disputator: <entryFree id="n14358" type="main" key="dispu^ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dispŭtātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14358.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a disputer, disputant</hi> (rare): subtilis, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">suae artis unumquemque et auctorem et disputatorem optimum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:12" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 12 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
disputatorie: <entryFree id="n14359" type="hapax" key="dispu^ta_to_ri^e"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dispŭtātōrĭe</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>disputator</etym>, <sense id="n14359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in the manner of disputants</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
disputatrix: <entryFree id="n14360" type="main" key="dispu^ta_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dispŭtātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a female disputant, one given to disputation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam virtus erit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:20:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 20, 7</bibl></cit>; as the Lat. equivalent of <foreign lang="greek">dialektikh/</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">te/xnh</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">the art of disputing</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
disputo: <entryFree id="n14361" type="main" key="dispu^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-pŭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n14361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14361.1" n="I" level="1"> Orig. in mercant. lang., <hi rend="ital">to cast</hi> or <hi rend="ital">reckon up, to calculate</hi> a sum by going over its items; <hi rend="ital">to estimate, compute</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi disputata est ratio cum argentario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 55</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14361.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> beyond the mercant. sphere, <hi rend="ital">to weigh, examine, investigate, treat of, discuss</hi> a doubtful subject, either by meditating or (more commonly) by speaking upon it (good prose; very freq. in Cicero's philos. and rhet. writings; cf. for syn.: dissero, discepto); constr. usual. with <hi rend="ital">accus.</hi> of <hi rend="ital">neutr. pron.</hi> or with <hi rend="ital">de</hi> and <case>abl.</case> (cf. Krebs, Antibarb. p. 372): <cit><quote lang="la">in meo corde eam rem volutavi et diu disputavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea, quae disputavi, disserere malui quam judicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:40" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque haec in eam sententiam disputo, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:25:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 25, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid pro tribunali multis verbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:34:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 34, 83</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">(Druides) multa de sideribus atque eorum motu, etc.... disputant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de moribus, de virtutibus, de re publica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de omni re in contrarias partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:34:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 34, 158</bibl></cit>: cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:86:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 86, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab his, qui contra disputant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non inscite ad ea disputat, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quale sit de quo disputabitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disputatur in consilio a Petreio et Afranio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 67</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc utriusque disceptator eccum adest, age disputa,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>relate, tell</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 5, 2, 16</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:4:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 4, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem alicui,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to state, represent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. prol. 50</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">isti in eo disputant, Contaminari non decere fabulas,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>maintain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:prol. 15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. prol. 15</bibl></cit> Ruhnk.—</sense><sense id="n14361.3" n="B" level="2"> In late Lat. </sense><sense id="n14361.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To discuss, preach</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in synagoga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:17:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 17, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">18, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">20, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14361.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To dispute, contend</hi> in words: <cit><quote lang="la">quis eorum major esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:9:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Marc. 9, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum diabolo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,026:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Jud. 9</bibl></cit>. <pb n="594" /> <cb n="DISS" /></sense></entryFree>
disquiro: <entryFree id="n14362" type="main" key="disqui_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-quīro</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>quaero</etym>, <sense id="n14362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to inquire diligently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to investigate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 239</bibl>; Lampr<bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Alex. Sev. 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,024:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Macc. 2, 31</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
disquisitio: <entryFree id="n14363" type="main" key="disqui_si_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">disquīsītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>disquiro</etym>, <sense id="n14363.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> (judicial) <hi rend="ital">inquiry</hi>, <hi rend="ital">investigation</hi>: in magnis disquisitionibus repentinisque periculis, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:28:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 28, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:31" default="NO" valid="yes">26, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 60</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
disraro: <entryFree id="n14364" type="main" key="disra_ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-rāro</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-rāro</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n14364.0" n="I" level="1"> In econom. lang., <hi rend="ital">to thin out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make thin</hi> by cutting, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:32:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 32, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:6:36" default="NO">5, 6, 36</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14364.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14364.2" n="(a)" level="5"> Of nutriment, <hi rend="ital">to thin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dilute</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:15:152" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 15, 152</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14364.3" n="(b)" level="5"> Of the body, <hi rend="ital">to cause to perspire excessively</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:15:133" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 15, 133</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:1:11:84" default="NO">1, 11, 84</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
disrumpo: <entryFree id="n14365" type="main" key="disrumpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">disrumpo</orth>, v. dirumpo.</entryFree>
dissaepimentum: <entryFree id="n14366" type="hapax" key="dissaepi_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissaepīmentum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-sēp-</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>dissaepio</etym>, <sense id="n14366.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that which separates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a partition</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=166:12" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 166, 12</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
dissaepio: <entryFree id="n14367" type="main" key="dissaepi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-saepĭo</orth> (less correctly <orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-sēpio</orth>), <itype>psi, ptum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n14367.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to part off</hi> by a boundary, <hi rend="ital">to separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divide</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n14367.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aër dissaepit colles, atque aëra montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:998" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 998</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">parietibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=162" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 162</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">vix ea limitibus dissaepserat omnia certis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 69</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bene dissaepti foedera mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 335" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 335</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14367.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to tear apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tear to pieces</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissaepto aggere utitur, et truncas rupes in templa Praecipitat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:880" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 880</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14367.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: tenui sane muro dissaepiunt id quod excipiunt, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 4, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dissaeptio: <entryFree id="n14368" type="main" key="dissaepti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissaeptĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dissaepio</etym>, <sense id="n14368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a partition</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 8, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14368.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut dissaeptio juris humani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:24:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 24, 10</bibl></cit> Hertz (dub. Madv. discerptio; Weissenb. dissertio).</sense></entryFree>
dissaeptum: <entryFree id="n14369" type="main" key="dissaeptum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissaeptum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14369.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a barrier</hi>, <hi rend="ital">partition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxea domorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:951" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 951</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so too of the diaphragm: quod ventrem et cetera intestina secernit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 6, § 77</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dissaeptus: <entryFree id="n14370" type="main" key="dissaeptus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissaeptus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from dissaepio.</entryFree>
dissavior: <entryFree id="n14371" type="main" key="dissa_vior"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissāvior</orth>, v. dissuavior.</entryFree>
disseco: <entryFree id="n14372" type="main" key="disse^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-sĕco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dissĭc-</orth>), <itype>ŭi, ctum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n14372.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut asunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut in pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissect</hi> (post-Aug.; <cit><quote lang="la">esp. freq. in Pliny the elder— cf.: seco, meto, findo, scindo): unionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 35, 58, § 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 37, 70, § 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput viperae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 4, 21, § 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 30, 9, 23, § 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ranas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 32, 9, 36, § 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multos medios serra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 8, p. 214</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14372.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissecari cordibus suis,</quote> <trans><tr>to be cut to the heart</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:7:54 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 7, 54 al.</bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
dissectus: <entryFree id="n14373" type="main" key="dissectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from disseco.</entryFree>
disseminatio: <entryFree id="n14374" type="main" key="disse_mi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissēmĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dissemino</etym>, <sense id="n14374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a scattering of seed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sowing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disseminating</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">evangelii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Fuga in Persec. 6</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">malevolorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
disseminator: <entryFree id="n14375" type="main" key="disse_mi^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissēmĭnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who spreads abroad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">incontinentiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Psa. 36, 49</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dissemino: <entryFree id="n14376" type="main" key="disse_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-sēmĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>—<usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, to scatter seed, to sow; hence, trop., <sense id="n14376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to spread abroad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disseminate</hi> (rare, but good prose); <cit><quote lang="la">coupled with spargere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 12, 30</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:23:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 23, 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">malum latius opinione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 4, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">causam morbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupidines populis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rumorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 6 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scientiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:15:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 15, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dissensio: <entryFree id="n14377" type="main" key="dissensi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissensĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dissentio</etym>, <sense id="n14377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">difference of opinion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disagreement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissension</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discord</hi> (good prose): <cit><quote lang="la">inter homines de jure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:56:238" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 56, 238</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:13:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 13, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animorum disjunctio dissensionem facit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter aliquos sine acerbitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:25:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 25, 87</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:22" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 22</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc dissidio ac dissensione facta, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 3, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 21, 77</bibl> (twice); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:31:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 31, 1</bibl> (twice); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 20, 4</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">Zenonis a superioribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 1, 11, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de bono oratore cum populo' dissensio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:49:185" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 49, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:67:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 67, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 41 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 3</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ordinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 27</bibl></cit> et saep.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:37:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 37, 102</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:7:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 7, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3</bibl>. 1, 3; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:32 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 32 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14377.1" n="II" level="1"> Of inanimate things, <hi rend="ital">disagreement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incompatibility</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utilium cum honestis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:13:56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 13, 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 20:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 20, 2</bibl></cit>. <cb n="DISS" /></sense></entryFree>
dissensus: <entryFree id="n14378" type="main" key="dissensus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from dissentio.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n14379" type="main" key="dissensus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissensus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>dissentio</etym>, <sense id="n14379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dissension</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disagreement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discord</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:455" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 455</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:10:558" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 10, 558</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:17:2:65:section=3" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 17, 2, 65, § 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:46:3:80" default="NO">46, 3, 80</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dissentaneus: <entryFree id="n14380" type="main" key="dissenta_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissentānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14380.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">disagreeing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contrary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissentaneous</hi> (opp. consentaneus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:2:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 2, 7</bibl>; cf. Nigid. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 100, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dissentio: <entryFree id="n14381" type="main" key="dissenti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-sentĭo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> (opp. consentio), <sense id="n14381.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to differ in sentiment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dissent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disagree</hi> (freq. and class.).—Constr. usually <hi rend="ital">ab aliquo;</hi> less freq. <hi rend="ital">inter se</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cum aliquo</hi>, the <case>dat.</case> or <hi rend="ital">absol</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">soles nonnumquam hac de re a me in disputationibus nostris dissentire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:25:80" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 25, 80</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:63:214" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 63, 214</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 8</bibl> et saep.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also of actual enmity,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 20, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 7, 29, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Galli) tantum a ceterarum gentium more ac natura dissentiunt,</quote> <trans><tr>differ</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ab relicuorum malis moribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab hoc publico more,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a computatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 10, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illi inter se dissentiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:6:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sibi ipsum dissentire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 26, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ilico dissentiamus cum Epicuro, ubi dicit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 18" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Harusp. Resp. 25, 54</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also, secum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 11, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissentire condicionibus foedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui ad voluptatem omnia referunt, longe dissentiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 9, 23</bibl></cit>; so <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:11:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 11, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:3:13" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:9 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 5, 9 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so also of positive enmity,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 11, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Auct. B. Hisp. 37: quia nescio quid in philosophia dissentiret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nisi quid tu dissentis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:1:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 1, 79</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14381.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanimate or abstract subjects, <hi rend="ital">to be unlike</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dissimilar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to differ</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">affectio inconstans et a se ipsa dissentiens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:13:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 13, 29</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so. quid ipsum a se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">responsum ab interrogatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gestus ac vultus ab oratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba ab animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 1, 29</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 7, 42, § 90</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptoris voluntas cum scripto ipso,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 11, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationi vita,</quote> <trans><tr>to be out of harmony with</tr>, <tr>inconsistent with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 20:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 20, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec fallebat Antipatrum dissentire ab animis gratulantium vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:1:17" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 1, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14381.2" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">observa numquid tua vestis domusque dissentiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 20:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 20, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:3:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 3, 12</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n14381.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To protest</hi>, <hi rend="ital">object</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec dissentit eum mortis potitum, quem mens vivom se cernere credit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:766" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 766</bibl></cit>; cf. Munro ad loc.!*? Once in the <hi rend="ital">dep.</hi> form: qui intellegunt, dissentiuntur, Cael. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 801</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
dissentior: <entryFree id="n14382" type="main" key="dissentior"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissentior</orth>, <itype>iri, 4</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos>, v. dissentio <sense id="n14382.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
disseparatio: <entryFree id="n14383" type="main" key="disse_pa^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissēpărātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>disseparo</etym>, <sense id="n14383.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a parting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separation</hi> (late Lat.), Auct. Decl. in Catil. 31.</sense></entryFree>
disseparo: <entryFree id="n14384" type="main" key="disse_pa^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-sēpăro</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n14384.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divide</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Nazar.</author> Paneg. Const. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">acus quae capillos a medio, fronte disseparat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 282, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dissepio: <entryFree id="n14385" type="main" key="disse_pio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-sēpio</orth>, etc., v. dissaepio, etc.</entryFree>
disserenasco: <entryFree id="n14386" type="hapax" key="disse^re_nasco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissĕrēnasco</orth>, <itype>āvi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n14386.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n. impers.</hi> [dissereno], <hi rend="ital">to clear up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">grow clear</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum undique disserenāsset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:46:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 46, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dissereno: <entryFree id="n14387" type="main" key="disse^re_no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-sĕrēno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n14387.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. impers.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14387.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be clear</hi>, as if by dispersing the clouds: <cit><quote lang="la">si cacumina (montium) pura flent, disserenabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 35, 82, § 356</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14387.2" n="II" level="1"> In late Lat., <hi rend="ital">act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make clear.</hi>—Only trop., <hi rend="ital">to clear away</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">disserena oculis nostris nubilum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Conf. 13, 15</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">to cheer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores procellosos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 6, 6 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
dissero: <entryFree id="n14388" type="main" key="disse^ro1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-sĕro</orth>, <itype>sēvi</itype> (serui, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 14, 12</bibl>), <itype>sĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n14388.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to scatter seed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sow here and there</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sow</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Caeciliana (lactuca) mense Januario recte disseritur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:26" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina in areolas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">res in arcas (olitor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=64" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 64</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">dissita pars animae per totum corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:143" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 143</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:ib. 377" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 377</bibl>; 4, 888.—</sense><sense id="n14388.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To fix in the earth at intervals</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to plant here and there</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">taleae mediocribus intermissis spatiis disserebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 73 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n14389" type="main" key="disse^ro2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-sĕro</orth>, <itype>rŭi, rtum</itype> (<sense id="n14389.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> disserta, first in <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Isa. 4, 11</bibl>; class. form dĭsertus, as a <pos>P. a.</pos>, is very freq.; v. under <cb n="DISS" /> <pos>P. a.</pos>), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>—<usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, to set forth in order, arrange distinctly; hence, <hi rend="ital">to examine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">argue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discuss;</hi> or (more freq.) <hi rend="ital">to speak</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discourse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treat of</hi> a thing (good prose and very freq., esp. in Cic. and Quint.—cf.: disputo, discepto). </sense><sense id="n14389.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> (so in Cic., and usually only with pronouns, but in Tac. also freq. with nominal subjects): <cit><quote lang="la">idonea mihi Laelii persona visa est, quae de amicitia ea ipsa dissereret, quae disputata ab eo meminisset Scaevola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 21, 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil de ea re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seditiosa de aliqua re,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">permulta de eloquentia cum Antonio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 3, 13</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haec cum ipsis philosophis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae inter me et Scipionem de amicitia disserebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:10:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 10, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui haec nuper disserere coeperunt, cum corporibus simul animos interire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec subtilius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid pluribus verbis in senatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 12, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea, quae disputavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:40:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 40, 95</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:chapter=5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:11:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 11, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea lege, qua credo omnibus in rebus disserendis utendum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauci bona libertatis incassum disserere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 3, 81</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus negotii initium, ordinem, finem curatius disseram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">paucis instituta majorum domi militiaeque, quomodo rem publicam habuerint, etc., disserere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> Kritz.; for the latter constr. with a <hi rend="ital">rel. clause</hi>, cf. Quint. praef. § 22, and 1, 10, 22; and with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">malunt disserere, nihil esse in auspiciis, quam quid sit ediscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:47:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 47, 105</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:1:2 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 1, 2 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14389.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Scipio triduum disseruit de re publica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 4, 14</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> et saep.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: consuetudo de omnibus rebus in contrarias partes disserendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de Scripturis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 17, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut inter quos disseritur, conveniat, quid sit id, de quo disseratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Less freq. for de, super aliqua re, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:19:1:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 19, 1, 19</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14389.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut memini Catonem anno ante quam est mortuus mecum et cum Scipione disserere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:3:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 3, 11</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita disseruit: duas esse vias, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in disserendo rudes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:25 al" default="NO">12, 2, 25 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">causa disserendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio disserendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fat. 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 1, 8, 30</bibl>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">ars bene disserendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adhibita disserendi elegantia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">disserendi subtilitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:15:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 15, 68</bibl></cit> et saep. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭsertus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (for dissertus. Cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">difficultas laborque discendi disertam negligentiam reddidit.
