Malunt enim disserere, nihil esse in auspiciis, quam quid sit ediscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:47:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 47, 105</bibl></cit>; and: disertus a disserendo dictus, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=72:15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 72, 15</bibl>), <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">skilful in speaking on a subject; clear</hi>, <hi rend="ital">methodical in speaking; well-spoken</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fluent</hi> (less than eloquens, <hi rend="ital">eloquent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">disertos cognosse me nonnullos, eloquentem adhuc neminem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 21</bibl></cit>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:5:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 5, 18</bibl>; cf. also: facundus, loquax, dicax). </sense><sense id="n14389.4" n="A" level="2"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">disertorum oratione delenitus... utilitates non a sapientibus et fortibus viris sed a disertis et ornate dicentibus esse constitutae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 9, 36</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 3, 7</bibl> et saep.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:370" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 370</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:228" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 228</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 11, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:12:16" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 12, 16</bibl> et saep.—Cf. also, ora, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11:20" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 11, 20</bibl>; and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, Arpi, because within its limits Cicero was born, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:55" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">leporum disertus puer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 12, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">callidus et disertus homo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>sagacious</tr>, <tr>shrewd</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 7, 10</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:32:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 32, 129</bibl> (with eloquentior).—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:43:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 43, 111</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:54:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 54, 231</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:91:315" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 91, 315</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:49:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 49, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14389.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of discourse: <cit><quote lang="la">illam orationem disertam sibi et oratoriam videri, fortem et virilem non videri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:54:231" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 54, 231</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">historia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epilogus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:15:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 15, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Pont. 3, 5, 8 al.</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 8, 4</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:11:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 11, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8" default="NO">8</bibl> prooem. § 24; 8, 2, 21.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 21" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 21</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 2</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Adv.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clearly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">expressly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinctly; eloquently.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14389.6" n="(a)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭserte</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 1, 31</bibl>; Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 509, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 19</bibl> Fabri ad loc.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:25:4 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 25, 4 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:9:24" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 9, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 1, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:30" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 30</bibl>; <pb n="595" /> <cb n="DISS" /> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 9, 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14389.7" n="(b)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭsertim</orth>, Liv. Andr., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0400,001:Trag. v. 350" default="NO"><author>Att.</author> Trag. v. 350</bibl> Rib. (ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 509, 25 sq.</bibl>); <bibl default="NO"><author>Titin.</author> Com. v. 150</bibl> Rib. (ap. Non. ib.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:3:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 3, 87</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14389.8" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:38" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14389.9" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:2:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 2, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
disserpo: <entryFree id="n14390" type="hapax" key="disserpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-serpo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n14390.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to creep about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to spread imperceptibly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">late disserpunt tremores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:547" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 547</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dissertatio: <entryFree id="n14391" type="main" key="disserta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissertātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>disserto</etym>, <sense id="n14391.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a spoken dissertation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discourse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disquisition</hi> (not a written treatise; cf. disputatio; <cit><quote lang="la">late Lat.),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:4:1" default="NO">10, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:3:5" default="NO">14, 3, 5</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 68, 87, § 190</bibl>, the true reading is edissertatio) al.</sense></entryFree>
dissertator: <entryFree id="n14392" type="hapax" key="disserta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissertātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14392.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a disputant</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Apoth. 850</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dissertio: <entryFree id="n14393" type="main" key="disserti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissertĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>2. dissero</etym>, <sense id="n14393.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">destruction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abolition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur exsecrabilis ista nobis solis velut dissertio juris humani est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:24:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 24, 10</bibl></cit> (dub., this not being the etym. sense of the word; al. dissaeptio, discerptio).—</sense><sense id="n14393.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The explanation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">solution</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Matt. 13, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
disserto: <entryFree id="n14394" type="main" key="disserto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">disserto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>dissero</etym>, <sense id="n14394.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to discuss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">argue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">debate</hi> a thing; or <hi rend="ital">to dispute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">converse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">treat</hi> respecting a thing (ante-class. and post-Aug., esp. in Tac.): quid ego cum illo dissertem amplius? Cato ap. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=60:1" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 60, 1</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">dic mihi istuc, quod vos dissertatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 58</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vim Romanam pacisque bona dissertans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 69</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">haec atque talia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 11</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ostentandi gratia magno conventu hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:14:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 14, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totis exercitibus coram dissertare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dissertus: <entryFree id="n14395" type="main" key="dissertus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissertus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. 2. dissero <sense id="n14395.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
dissicio: <entryFree id="n14396" type="main" key="dissi^cio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissĭcio</orth>, v. disicio.</entryFree>
dissidentia: <entryFree id="n14397" type="hapax" key="dissi^denti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissĭdentĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dissideo</etym>, <sense id="n14397.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">diversity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contrariety</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 23, § 75</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dissideo: <entryFree id="n14398" type="main" key="dissi^de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-sĭdĕo</orth>, <itype>ēdi, essum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>sedeo</etym>, <sense id="n14398.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to sit apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be remote from</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be divided</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separated.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14398.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quantum Hypanis dissidet Eridano,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:12:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: sceptris nostris, *<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:370" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 370</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab omni dissidet turba procul Laïus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oed. 618" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Oed. 618</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:736" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 7, 736</bibl>.—Far more freq. and class., </sense><sense id="n14398.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to be at variance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to disagree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to think differently.</hi> —Constr. with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inter se</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14398.3" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullam esse gentem tam dissidentem a populo Romano odio quodam atque discidio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:13:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 13, 30</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a senatu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:62:223" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 62, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a tribuno plebis (consules),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:19:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 19, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a Pompeio in tantis rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a nobis (altera pars senatus),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 19</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">non verbis Stoicos a Peripateticis, sed universa re et tota sententia dissidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus a se ipse dissidens secumque discordans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 18, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Archytas iracundiam, videlicet dissidentem a ratione, seditionem quandam animi vere dicebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 38</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 2, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab ingenio matris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:7:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 7, 36</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14398.4" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inter se</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">leviter inter se dissident,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupiditates in animis inclusae inter se dissident atque discordant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:13:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 13, 44</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14398.5" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Cleanthe, doctore suo, quam multis rebus Chrysippus dissidet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 47, 143</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">non cum homine, sed cum causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 6, 15</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n14398.6" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus dissidens plebi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 2, 18</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">abl. manner</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex quo facile intellectu est verbis eos, non re dissidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:19:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 19, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capitali odio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">de qua (definitione summi boni) qui dissident, de omni vitae ratione dissident,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 43, 132</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:20:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 20, 53</bibl> (opp. congruae): <cit><quote lang="la">cum Julia primo concorditer et amore mutuo vixit, mox dissedit,</quote> <trans><tr>he fell out with her</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Medus dissidet armis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:8:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 8, 20</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dissidet miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissident olores et aquilae,</quote> <trans><tr>live at enmity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 74, 95, § 203</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">spes incesserat dissidere hostem in Arminium ac Segestem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>were divided into two factions</tr>, <tr>that of Arminius and Segestes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 55</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">histriones, propter quos dissidebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 37</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14398.7" n="B" level="2"> Of inanimate and abstract subjects in gen., <hi rend="ital">to be unlike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissimilar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">different</hi>, <hi rend="ital">various; to differ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disagree.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14398.8" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">a</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nostra non multum a Peripateticis dissidentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: scriptum<cb n="DISS" />  a sententia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:31:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 31, 140</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gestus a voce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:165 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 165 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n14398.9" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntas scriptoris cum scripto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba cum sententia scriptoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 13 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n14398.10" n="(g)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">si inaequalitate dissident (supercilia),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:79" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supercilia dissidentia (opp. constricta),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 11, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si toga dissidet impar,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>sits uneven</tr>, <tr>one-sided</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 96</bibl></cit> (cf. the opp. aequaliter sedet, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:141" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 141</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">si duo haec verba idem significant, neque ulla re aliqua dissident,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:24:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 24, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dissidium: <entryFree id="n14399" type="spur" key="dissidium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissidium</orth>, <itype>a false reading for discidium</itype>, q. v., and cf. Madv. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:Exc. II. p. 812 sq" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. Exc. II. p. 812 sq.</bibl></entryFree>
dissignatio: <entryFree id="n14400" type="gloss" key="dissigna_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissignātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, another form for designatio, q. v., Tab. Heracl. p. 53 al.</entryFree>
dissignator: <entryFree id="n14401" type="main" key="dissigna_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissignātor</orth>, v. designator.</entryFree>
dissilio: <entryFree id="n14402" type="main" key="dissi^li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-sĭlĭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 4</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>salio</etym>, <sense id="n14402.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to leap</hi> or <hi rend="ital">burst asunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fly apart.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14402.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">duo de concursu corpora lata si cita dissiliant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:385" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 385</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:391" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 391</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissiliunt ferventi saxa vapore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:491" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 491</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">silex igni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 18, 29, § 135</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mucro ictu dissiluit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:740" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 740</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aera (sc. frigore),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:363" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 363</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uva pressa pede,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:6:20" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec loca vi quondam et vasta convolsa ruina Dissiluisse ferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:416" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 416</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:616" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 616</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:260" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 260</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lamina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:173" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 173</bibl></cit>; 12, 488 al.: boves degustatā bupresti, <hi rend="ital">burst open</hi>, = dirumpere, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 22, 36, § 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 29, 4, 27, § 89</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">risu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 113" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 113 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(vox) ubi Dissiluit semel in multas,</quote> <trans><tr>has broken up into many</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:605" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 605</bibl></cit> (preceded by: partis in cunctas dividitur vox).—</sense><sense id="n14402.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To leap</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in Jordanem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,023:9:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Macc. 9, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14402.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratia fratrum geminorum dissiluit,</quote> <trans><tr>was dissolved</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dissimilis: <entryFree id="n14403" type="main" key="dissi^mi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-sĭmĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n14403.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unlike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissimilar</hi>, <hi rend="ital">different</hi> (as the opp. of similis and consimilis, v. 3. dis, II.; cf.: dispar, impar, absimilis; very freq. and class.).—Constr. with the <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <case>dat.</case>, with <hi rend="ital">atque</hi>, <hi rend="ital">et</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inter se</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi> (for this variety in the construction, cf. esp. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 81 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> to 83 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>). </sense><sense id="n14403.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(P. Crassus) dum Cyri et Alexandri similis esse voluit, et L. Crassi et multorum Crassorum inventus est dissimillimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=81" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 81</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin..</hi> alicujus dissimilis in tribunatu reliquaque omni vita, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 34, 129</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">Scetani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artificium hoc ceterorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:19:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 19, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">offensio odii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 51</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cives tui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 10, 6, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:24:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 24, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 7, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:93:320" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 93, 320</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:273 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 273 al.</bibl>; cf. also under </sense><sense id="n14403.2" n="(d)" level="5">.—</sense><sense id="n14403.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil tam dissimile quam Cotta Sulpicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=56" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis homini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:22:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 22, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illa contentio huic judicio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:17:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 17, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc superiori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:6:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 4, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proximo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 33, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam fortibus ausis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:282" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 282</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc illi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:6:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 6, 49</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14403.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">atque</hi> or <hi rend="ital">et</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:504" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 504</bibl>; cf.: aut quiescendum, quod est non dissimile atque ire in Solonium aut Antium; <cit><quote lang="la">aut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">haec consilia non sunt dissimilia, ac si quis aegro, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissimilis est militum causa et tua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:24:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 24, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:28:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 28, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:82:285" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 82, 285</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14403.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">inter se</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissimiles longe inter se variosque colores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:783" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 783</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:720" default="NO" valid="yes">2, 720</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:7:25 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 7, 25 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 82 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:17 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 17 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">cum inter vos in dicendo dissimillimi sitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 29</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and in a twofold construction: qui sunt et inter se dissimiles et aliorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:83:287" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 83, 287</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissimillimi motus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos, qui nascuntur eodem tempore, posse in dissimiles incidere naturas propter caeli dissimilitudinem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">hac in re multum dissimiles,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid sit in quoque dissimile,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro dissimillimo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:5:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 9 al.</bibl></cit>—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: aetate et forma, haud dissimili in dominum erat, <hi rend="ital">to his master</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">so as to pass for his master</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 39</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissimilis valde ab omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,056:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Dan. 7, 19</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dissĭmĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">differently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in a different manner</hi> (rarely): <cit><quote lang="la">efficere voluptates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:3:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 3, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 89:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 89, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:18:12:3 al" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 18, 12, 3 al.</bibl>—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud dissimiliter navibus sine gubernaculo vagis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:48:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 48, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dissimilitudo: <entryFree id="n14404" type="main" key="dissi^mi^li^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissĭmĭlĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dissimilis</etym>, <sense id="n14404.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unlikeness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">difference</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissimilitude</hi> (very <cb n="DISS" /> freq. in <number>sing.</number> and <number>plur.</number>); <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 20, 74</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:59:252" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 59, 252</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:7:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 7, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:10:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 10, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:2:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:92" default="NO">9, 3, 92</bibl> et saep.; <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:107" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 30, 107 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:7:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 7, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:82:285" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 82, 285</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:45:94 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 45, 94 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
dissimulamentum: <entryFree id="n14405" type="main" key="dissi^mu^la_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissĭmŭlāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>dissimulo</etym>, <sense id="n14405.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dissembling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pretence</hi> (post-class.), App. Flor. <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 3, p. 341, 21; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mag. p. 329, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dissimulanter: <entryFree id="n14406" type="main" key="dissi^mu^lanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissĭmŭlanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n14406.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dissemblingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secretly</hi>, etc., v. dissimulo <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
dissimulantia: <entryFree id="n14407" type="hapax" key="dissi^mu^lanti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissĭmŭlantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dissimulo</etym>, <sense id="n14407.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dissembling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">coupled with ironia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:67:270" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 67, 270</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dissimulatio: <entryFree id="n14408" type="main" key="dissi^mu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissĭmŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dissembling</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concealing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disguising</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissimulation</hi> (good prose). </sense><sense id="n14408.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:85" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 3, 85</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">veste servili in dissimulationem sui compositus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 6, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14408.2" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">the Socratic</hi> <foreign lang="greek">ei)rwnei/a</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 5, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 29</bibl>; but too restricted for that idea, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 44</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14408.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A disregarding</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:13:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 13, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14408.4" n="B" level="2"> In late Lat., <hi rend="ital">negligence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carelessness</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 6</bibl> prooem. § 1; so ib. § 3; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Mil. 1, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dissimulator: <entryFree id="n14409" type="main" key="dissi^mu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissĭmŭlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14409.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dissembler</hi>, <hi rend="ital">concealer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 5, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 56</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 9, 9 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
dissimulo: <entryFree id="n14410" type="main" key="dissi^mu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissĭmŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>dissimilis</etym>, <sense id="n14410.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to feign that a thing is not that which it is; to dissemble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disguise; to hide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conceal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep secret</hi> (cf.: fingo, simulo, confingo, comminiscor—very freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n14410.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil fingam, nihil dissimulem, nihil obtegam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid (with tegere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 19, 2</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with obtegere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 29</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with celare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:1:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 1, 105</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">with occultare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:105" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 30, 105</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:31:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 31, 6</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:31:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 31, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec, ut emat melius, nec ut vendat, quicquam simulabit aut dissimulabit vir bonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 8, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam in actione dissimulata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: consonantium quaedam insequente vocali dissimulatur, <hi rend="ital">is obscured</hi>, said of elision in poetry, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">occultam febrem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">metum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:20:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 2, 20, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gaudia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:653" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 653</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:9:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 9, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natum cultu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se,</quote> <trans><tr>to assume another form</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:731" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 731</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>concealing his divinity</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:5:504" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 5, 504</bibl>; cf. also <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> with mid. force: <cit><quote lang="la">dissimulata deam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:507" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 507</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Silv. 1, 2, 14</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and virum veste longa (Achilles),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:690" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 690</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14410.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissimulabam me harum sermoni operam dare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plaut.</author> Epid. 2, 2, 54</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:5:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 5, 1, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:7:5 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 7, 5 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n14410.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With a <hi rend="ital">rel. clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec judices, a quo sint moti, dissimulant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:9:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 9, 7</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6</bibl> prooem. § 7; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:291 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 291 al.</bibl>—* </sense><sense id="n14410.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">quasi</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissimulabo, hos quasi non videam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: plane ea est; <cit><quote lang="la">sed quomodo dissimulabat!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:5:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 5, 53</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:4:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 4, 3, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 2, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:108" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 30, 108</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:19:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 19, 40</bibl> (opp. fateri); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 19, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:17:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 17, 151</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">dissimulant,</quote> <trans><tr>they repress their feelings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:516" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 516</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">primo fingere alia, dissimulare de conjuratione, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 47:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 47, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de condicione sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:13:4" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 13, 4</bibl></cit>.— * </sense><sense id="n14410.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To leave unnoticed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to neglect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">damnosam curationem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1</bibl></cit> prooem. § <cit><quote lang="la">5: quod dissimulatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 21, 3</bibl></cit>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dissĭmŭlanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">dissemblingly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clandestinely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">secretly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">non aperte, nec eodem modo semper, sed varie dissimulanterque conclusis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:79:274" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 79, 274</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 5</bibl>, b. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 21</bibl> (opp. Palam); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:20:132 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 20, 132 al.</bibl>— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> do not occur.</sense></entryFree>
dissipabilis: <entryFree id="n14411" type="hapax" key="dissi^pa_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissĭpābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dissipo</etym>, <sense id="n14411.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be scattered</hi> or <hi rend="ital">dispersed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis et aër,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:12:31" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 12, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dissipatio: <entryFree id="n14412" type="main" key="dissi^pa_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissĭpātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a scattering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dispersing</hi> (a Ciceronian word). * </sense><sense id="n14412.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">hic error ac dissipatio civium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:4:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14412.2" n="II" level="1"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">destruction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annihilation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interitus et dissipatio corporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:25:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 25, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>plundering</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 5, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:24:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 24, 3 al.</bibl>—As a rhet. flgure, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:54:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 54, 207</bibl> (so ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 35</bibl>): ita contra illa <pb n="596" /> <cb n="DISS" /> dispersa sunt, quae a Cicerone <hi rend="ital">dissupata</hi> dici puto, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dissipator: <entryFree id="n14413" type="hapax" key="dissi^pa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissĭpātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14413.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a disperser</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroyer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Psych. 34 praef.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
dissipatrix: <entryFree id="n14414" type="main" key="dissi^pa_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissĭpātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dissipator</etym>, <sense id="n14414.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who scatters</hi> or <hi rend="ital">destroys</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Serm. 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dissipo: <entryFree id="n14415" type="main" key="dissi^po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-sĭpo</orth>, <itype>or</itype>, acc. to many MSS., <orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-sŭpo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum</itype> (<sense id="n14415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> in the <hi rend="ital">tmesis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">disque supatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:651" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 651</bibl></cit>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>SUPO = jacio, v. the art. ‡ supat; hence, i. q. disicio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to spread abroad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scatter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disperse</hi> (very freq. and class., esp. in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n14415.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14415.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">claras scintillas dissupat ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 163</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 181</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis totis se passim dissipavit castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Medea dicitur) in fuga fratris sui membra in iis locis, qua se parens persequeretur, dissipavisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 9, 22</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa Quirini,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:16:14" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 16, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui dissipatos homines congregavit et ad societatem vitae convocavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:25:62" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 25, 62</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dispersi ac dissipati discedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:58:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 58, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 24, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:55:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 55, 1</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">dissupat in corpus sese cibus omne animantum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:350" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 350</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">piceum venenum per ossa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:801" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 801</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—Mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes dispersi dissipantur in finitimas civitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:5" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> Herz.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 28</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14415.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n14415.4" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="dom">Milit. t. t.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to disperse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rout</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scatter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">put to flight</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">phalangem (for which, shortly after, disjecerunt),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordines pugnantium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 2:2:11" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 2, 2, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ib. 2:1:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: classem, Lentul. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fugam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:39:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 39, 8</bibl></cit>; cf <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:11:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 11, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes copias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:5:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praesidia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:9:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 9, 4</bibl></cit> et saep.—Hence <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aper dissipat canes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:231" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 231</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 343</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14415.5" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of abstract subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">dissipata fuga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:27" default="NO" valid="yes">38, 27</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">collectis ex dissipato cursu militibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9" default="NO" valid="yes">9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">respublica dispersa et dissipata,</quote> <trans><tr>dissolved</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14415.6" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="dom">Medic. t. t.</usg>, like discutere, <hi rend="ital">to disperse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissipate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discuss</hi> morbid matter: <cit><quote lang="la">humorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:28:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 28, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suppurationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 263" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 263</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14415.7" n="3" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to demolish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overthrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy; to squander</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissipate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuam deturbant, affligunt, comminuunt, dissipant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:38:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 38, 93</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">turres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis cuncta disturbat et dissipat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:15:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 15, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii animum statim dissipari alii diu permanere censent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:9:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 9, 18</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 11, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">a majoribus possessiones relictas disperdere et dissipare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">rem familiarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:7:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 7, 5</bibl></cit>: patrimonium, Crassus in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 55</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">avitas opes per luxum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquias reip.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:30:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 30, 12</bibl></cit> et saep.</sense><sense id="n14415.8" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14415.9" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to disperse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spread abroad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circulate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disseminate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">scatter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia fere, quae sunt conclusa nunc artibus, dispersa et dissipata quondam fuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilius est enim apta dissolvere quam dissipata conectere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:71:235" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 71, 235</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of discourse,</quote> <trans><tr>unconnected</tr>, <tr>ill-arranged</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 65</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; 70, 233; <cit><quote lang="la">and transf. to the speaker: (Curio) cum tardus in cogitando, tum in instruendo dissipatus fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 59 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">famam istam fascium dissipaverunt,</quote> <trans><tr>they have spread abroad</tr>, <tr>published</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 6, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 19</bibl>; and with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum homines lauti et urbani sermones hujusmodi dissipassent, me magna pecunia a vera accusatione esse deductum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 6, 14</bibl>; Cael. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 8, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissipatum passim bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14415.10" n="B" level="2"> In partic. (acc. to I. B. 3.): <cit><quote lang="la">dissipat Evius curas edaces,</quote> <trans><tr>drives away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:11:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 11, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplexus,</quote> <trans><tr>disturbs</tr>, <tr>interrupts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:2:57" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 2, 57</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dissiptum: <entryFree id="n14416" type="main" key="dissiptum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissiptum</orth>, <itype>another form of dissaeptum</itype>, v. dissaepio.</entryFree>
dissitus: <entryFree id="n14417" type="main" key="dissi^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from 1. dissero.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n14418" type="main" key="dissi^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-sĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <sense id="n14418.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lying apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remote</hi> (an Appuleian word), opp. assitus, App. Flor. <hi rend="ital">init.</hi> p. 340: <cit><quote lang="la">femora, i. q. divaricata,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> M. 7, p. 198, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dissociabilis: <entryFree id="n14419" type="main" key="disso^ci^a_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissŏcĭābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dissocio</etym>. * <sense id="n14419.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dividing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Oceanus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 3, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14419.1" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that cannot be united</hi>, <hi rend="ital">irreconcilable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incompatible</hi>: olim res miscere,<cb n="DISS" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Ruf. 2, 238</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dissocialis: <entryFree id="n14420" type="hapax" key="disso^ci^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissŏcĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14420.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">irreconcilable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">repugnant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanis animal dissociale cibis (of the Jews who separate themselves in respect to food),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Rutil.</author> Itin. 1, 384</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dissociatio: <entryFree id="n14421" type="main" key="disso^ci^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissŏcĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14421.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a separation</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 1, 1, § 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:57" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 13, 11, § 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dissocio: <entryFree id="n14422" type="main" key="disso^ci^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-sŏcĭo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n14422.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to separate from fellowship</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to disjoin</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disunite.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14422.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (almost exclusively <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">artas partis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:355" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 355</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dissociata locis concordi pace ligavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: montes opaca valle, * <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 16, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bruttia ora profundo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:3:32" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 3, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14422.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to separate in sentiment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to disunite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set at variance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">estrange</hi> (freq. in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">morum dissimilitudo dissociat amicitias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 20, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines antea dissociatos jucundissimo inter se sermonis vinculo colligavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">barbarorum copias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 55 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populum armis civilibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:10:4" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos civium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disertos a doctis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:19:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 19, 72</bibl></cit> (cf. shortly before: doctrinarum divortia facta); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">legionem a legione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excidium (Tencteris) minitans ni causam suam dissociarent,</quote> <trans><tr>gave up</tr>, <tr>abandoned</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 56</bibl></cit> (shortly before: illi Tencteros, ulteriores etiam nationes <hi rend="ital">socias</hi> bello vocabant); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dissolubilis: <entryFree id="n14423" type="main" key="disso^lu_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissŏlūbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dissolvo</etym>, <sense id="n14423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be dissolved</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissoluble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortale omne animal et dissolubile et dividuum sit necesse est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:12:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 12, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">coagmentatio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 8, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 8, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 8, 10</bibl>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mutabilius et dissolubilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Genes. 8" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Genes. 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dissolute: <entryFree id="n14424" type="main" key="disso^lu_te"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissŏlūte</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n14424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">loosely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disconnectedly; laxly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negligently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carelessly;</hi> v. dissolvo, <hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
dissolutio: <entryFree id="n14425" type="main" key="disso^lu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissŏlūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dissolvo</etym>, <sense id="n14425.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dissolving</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroying</hi>, <hi rend="ital">breaking up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissolution</hi> (good prose). </sense><sense id="n14425.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naturae (mors),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:11:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 11, 31</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stomachi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>looseness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 22, 91, § 248</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14425.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14425.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">an abolishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a destruction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legum omnium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 50</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <hi rend="ital">ruin</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 8, 22</bibl>. </sense><sense id="n14425.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n14425.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A reply</hi>, <hi rend="ital">refutation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">criminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 3, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14425.6" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to dissolutus, A.) As rhet. t. t., <hi rend="ital">want of connection</hi>, <hi rend="ital">interruption</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">constructio verborum tum conjunctionibus copuletur, tum dissolutionibus relaxetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 6, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:50" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14425.7" n="3" level="3"> (Acc. to dissolutus, B.) Of character, <hi rend="ital">looseness</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">weakness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">effeminacy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">frivolity; dissoluteness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si humanitas appellanda est in acerbissima injuria (sc. vindicanda) remissio animi ac dissolutio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">judiciorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 59 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Treb. Pol.</author> XXX. Tyr. 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissolutio et languor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">animorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. Sap. 4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Cons. Sap. 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dissolutor: <entryFree id="n14426" type="main" key="disso^lu_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissŏlūtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14426.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a destroyer</hi> (late Lat.): sepulcrorum, Cod. Th. 3, 16, 1; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 17, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dissolutrix: <entryFree id="n14427" type="hapax" key="disso^lu_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissŏlūtrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dissolutor</etym>, <sense id="n14427.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who destroys</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a destroyer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis (mors),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 42</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dissolutus: <entryFree id="n14428" type="main" key="disso^lu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissŏlūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from dissolvo.</entryFree>
dissolvo: <entryFree id="n14429" type="main" key="dissolvo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-solvo</orth>, <itype>solvi, sŏlūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n14429.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to loosen asunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to unloose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disunite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissolve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n14429.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14429.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">facilius est apta dissolvere quam dissipata conectere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:71:235" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 71, 235</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus ipsa suum eadem quae coagmentavit natura dissolvit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 20, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissolvunt nodos omnes et vincla relaxant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:356" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 356</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">contextum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 243</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stamina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:2" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornatus comae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 10, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capillum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 7, 23, § 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sparta navium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 9, 40, § 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:5:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 5, 1</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">nubila ventis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:514" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 514</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">nubes (ventus, with diducit),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glaciem (sol),</quote> <trans><tr>to melt</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:964" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 964</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aes (fulmen),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:352" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 352</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora (vis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se (venti vortex),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:446" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 446</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tenebras luce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=79" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 79</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">dissolutum navigium vel potius dissipatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 11, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">navem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:22:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 22, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:8:18" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 8, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stomachum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to loosen</tr>, <tr>relax</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:256" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 23, 96, § 256</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ilia sua visu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 24, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">resinam omnem oleo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:123" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 20, 25, § 123</bibl></cit>: <cb n="DISS" /> collegia, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cohortem Germanorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 12</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">animam,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to die</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:601" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 601</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:456" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 456</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:11:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 11, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14429.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n14429.4" n="1" level="3"> In mercant. lang., <hi rend="ital">to pay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discharge</hi> what one owes: <cit><quote lang="la">dinumerando solvere: aes alienum praediis venditis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:20:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 20, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 13, § 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:chapter=28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omne quod debuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 13, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae debeo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 4, 3, 50</bibl></cit>: pecuniam pro iis rebus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:87:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 87, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniam publicam ulli civitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenam,</quote> <trans><tr>to pay a fine</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:42:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 42, 100</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dissolvere et compensare damna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vota,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>;
