<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:66:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 66, 38</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n14429.5" n="b" level="4"> Mid., transf. to the person: quarum (possessionum) amore adducti dissolvi nullo modo possunt, <hi rend="ital">free</hi> or <hi rend="ital">release themselves</hi> from debt, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 8, 18</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14429.6" n="2" level="3"> In medic. lang., like digerere, discutere, <hi rend="ital">to discuss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissipate</hi> morbid matter, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 12, 48, § 122</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:23" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 6, 14, § 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:60 al" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 9, 38, § 60 al.</bibl></sense><sense id="n14429.7" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to dissolve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abolish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">abrogate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">annul</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14429.8" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">utilitas si amicitias conglutinaret, eadem commutata dissolveret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:9:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 9, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:42:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 42, 188</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">societatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:13:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Com. 13, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consortionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrimonia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 5, 17, 8</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">perjurium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:32:113" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 32, 113</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">religiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acta Caesaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">leges Caesaris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 8 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicia publica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc interdictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 14, 40</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">argentariam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regiam potestatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,006:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Lys. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">severitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:31:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 31, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 9, 5</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">mortem cuncta mortalium mala dissolvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 20</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">with pers. object: plerosque senectus dissolvit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 17, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14429.9" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n14429.10" n="1" level="3"> In rhet. and philos. lang., <hi rend="ital">to refute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">reply to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">answer</hi> an assertion: <cit><quote lang="la">criminatio tota dissoluta est (with diluere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:29:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 29, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">seu proposita confirmamus, seu contra dicta dissolvimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4</bibl></cit> prooem. § 6; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:30" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:21 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 21 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14429.11" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to I. B. 1. b.) <hi rend="ital">To release</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disengage</hi> one: <cit><quote lang="la">obsecro, dissolve jam me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 1, 2, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 1, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:1:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 1, 102</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dissŏ-lūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">unloosed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">loose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disconnected.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14429.12" n="A" level="2"> Of discourse: alterum nimis est vinctum, ut de industria factum appareat; <cit><quote lang="la">alterum nimis dissolutum, ut pervagatum ac vulgare videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:57:195" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 57, 195</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:11:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 11, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:62 al" default="NO">8, 6, 62 al.</bibl>—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dissolūtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, a gram. fig., i. q. <foreign lang="greek">a)su/ndeton</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">asyndeton</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 30, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:54:207" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 54, 207</bibl> (also ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 1, 34</bibl>).— </sense><sense id="n14429.13" n="B" level="2"> Of character, <hi rend="ital">lax</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remiss</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negligent</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inattentive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">careless; licentious</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissolute</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mollis, luxuriosus, effeminatus): negligere quid de se quisque sentiat, non solum arrogantis est, sed omnino dissoluti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:28:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 28, 99</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupio in tantis rei publicae periculis me non dissolutum videri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">in praetermittendo (opp. crudelis in animadvertendo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opp. vehemens,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Verres) omnium hominum dissolutissimus crudelissimusque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 56</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 25 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.: <cit><quote lang="la">quis tam dissolutus in re familiari fuisset, quis tam negligens, etc.?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 11, 38</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 40</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:11:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 11, 32</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">mens luxu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 49 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuetudo Graecorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libelli multo dissolutiores ipsis actionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 5 praef" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 5 praef.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil asperum ... nec tamen quicquam populare ac dissolutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:19:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 19, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:35:129" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 35, 129</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dissŏlūte</orth>. </sense><sense id="n14429.14" n="a" level="4"> Acc. to A., <hi rend="ital">loosely</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disconnectedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere demptis conjunctionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:39:135" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 39, 135</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14429.15" n="b" level="4"> Acc. to B., <hi rend="ital">laxly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">negligently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carelessly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissolute et turpiter scribere de restitutione alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vendere decumas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus suum relinquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factum aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 6, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dissonanter: <entryFree id="n14430" type="main" key="disso^nanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissŏnanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>dissono</etym>, <sense id="n14430.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inharmoniously</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconsistently</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Genes. ad Lit. 4, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dissonantia: <entryFree id="n14431" type="main" key="disso^nanti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissŏnantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14431.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dissonance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discrepancy</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud. Mam.</author> de Stat. An. 2, 21</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dissono: <entryFree id="n14432" type="main" key="disso^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-sŏno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n14432.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to disagree in</hi> <pb n="597" /> <cb n="DISS" /> <hi rend="ital">sound</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be dissonant</hi>, opp. consono (very rare; not ante-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n14432.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissonantes loci,</quote> <trans><tr>that produce discordant sounds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 8, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14432.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to disagree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to differ</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">an universa hujus temporis culturae respondeant, an aliqua dissonent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a veritate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 15, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praeceptis historiae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 26, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> in Luc. 6, 44</bibl>. (But in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:36" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 36</bibl>, the right reading is dissentio.)</sense></entryFree>
dissonus: <entryFree id="n14433" type="main" key="disso^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-sŏnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, opp. consonus, <sense id="n14433.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dissonant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discordant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confused</hi> (not anteAug.; nor in Verg., Ov., or Hor.). </sense><sense id="n14433.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">chorus canentium dissonum quiddam canere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:2:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 2, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">clamores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 20, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">voces (opp. congruens clamor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">questus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vapor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>making a dissonant sound</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 43, 43, § 112</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14433.2" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">disagreeing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">different</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes sermone moribusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 18</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">linguā agmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:19" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguis castra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:221" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 221</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">linguis turba,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil 1, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diversi postulantium habitus ac dissonae voces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:56:6" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 56, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ora vulgi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:3:289" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 3, 289</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 6</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">venustas (opp. jucunde consonat),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:72" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursus solis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 10, 15, § 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>in elegiac measure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:2:114" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 2, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nationes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elementa,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, § 912</bibl></cit> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil apud Latinos dissonum ab Romana re,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8, 2</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n14433.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">discordant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">jarring</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">collidens dissona corda Seditio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:45" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 45</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dissors: <entryFree id="n14434" type="main" key="dissors"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-sors</orth>, <itype>rtis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (opp. consors), <sense id="n14434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of a different fate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">not shared</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab omni milite dissors Gloria,</quote> <trans><tr>undivided</tr>, <tr>unshared</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:12:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 12, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dissortemque utero fetum tulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 8, 133</bibl></cit> (Heins.; al. discordem, v. discors).</sense></entryFree>
dissuadeo: <entryFree id="n14435" type="main" key="dissua_de^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-suādĕo</orth>, <itype>si, sum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>—A pub. law t. t., <sense id="n14435.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to advise against</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissuade</hi>, <hi rend="ital">oppose by argument</hi>, <hi rend="ital">resist</hi> a proposition. </sense><sense id="n14435.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop. (class.). </sense><sense id="n14435.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis enim umquam tam secunda contione legem agrariam suasit, quam ego dissuasi?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:37:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 37, 101</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">legem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:32" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenam suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 26</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14435.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui non modo non censuerit captivos remittendos, verum etiam dissuaserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:27:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 27, 101</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14435.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum praesertim (senatum) de captivis dissuasurus esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:30:110" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 30, 110</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14435.5" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: dissuasuri, ne hanc legem accipiatis, C. Gracch. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:10:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 10, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:2:10" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 7, 2, 10</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">societatem cum rege Pyrrho inire dissuasit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 2</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(C. Papirius) cum ferret legem de tribunis plebis reficiendis, dissuasimus nos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:25:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 25, 96</bibl></cit>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:31" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:33 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 4, 33 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14435.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> beyond the public sphere: <cit><quote lang="la">quod dissuadetur placet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 44</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">certum studiorum facere delectum nemo dissuaserit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:8:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 8, 7</bibl></cit>; so with <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:121" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 2, 121</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 81</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:619" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 619</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 53</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dissuasio: <entryFree id="n14436" type="main" key="dissua_si^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissuāsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dissuadeo</etym>, <sense id="n14436.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an advising to the contrary; a dissuasion</hi> (very rare): rogationis ejus, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:51:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 51, 140</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so opp. suasio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 2</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:39" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 94, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dissuasor: <entryFree id="n14437" type="main" key="dissua_sor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissuāsor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who advises to the contrary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an opposer</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:65:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 65, 261</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:248 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 248 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
dissuavior: <entryFree id="n14438" type="hapax" key="dissua_vi^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-suāvĭor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dis-sav-</orth>), <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n14438.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. a.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to kiss ardently</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuos oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0478,001:in Cic. Fam. 16:27" default="NO"><author>Q. Cic.</author> in Cic. Fam. 16, 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
dissuesco: <entryFree id="n14439" type="main" key="dissuesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-suesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n14439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to disuse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to become disused</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unaccustomed to</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> Avit. 4, 46</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dissuetudo: <entryFree id="n14440" type="main" key="dissue_tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-suētūdo</orth>, <itype>dinis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n14440.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a becoming unaccustomed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disusing</hi>, Ambros. de Cain et Abel. 2, 6, 22.</sense></entryFree>
dissulcus: <entryFree id="n14441" type="gloss" key="dissulcus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissulcus</orth> <itype>porcus dicitur, cum in cervice setas dividit</itype>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:72:14" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> 72, 14</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
dissulto: <entryFree id="n14442" type="main" key="dissulto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissulto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <sense id="n14442.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [dissilio], <hi rend="ital">to leap apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to fly in pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">burst asunder</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>, and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">dissultant ripae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanti crepitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 923</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferrum utrimque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 4, 15, § 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vulcanius ardor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:9:607" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 9, 607</bibl></cit>: aquae splendor, <hi rend="ital">darts here and there with tremulous motion</hi>, cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:7:143" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 143</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dissuo: <entryFree id="n14443" type="main" key="dissu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-sŭo</orth>, no <sense id="n14443.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>—<usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to unstitich</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to rip open;</hi> hence, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to</hi> <cb n="DIST" /> <hi rend="ital">open</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dissolve by degrees</hi> (a rare word). </sense><sense id="n14443.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:408" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 408</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">malas,</quote> <trans><tr>to open the mouth wide</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:59" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habebit vestimenta dissuta, caput nudum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Levit. 13, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14443.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiae dissuendae magis quam discindendae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 21, 76</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">sensim amicitias (opp. repente praecidere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:33:120" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 33, 120</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dissupo: <entryFree id="n14444" type="main" key="dissu^po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissŭpo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. dissipo.</entryFree>
dissutus: <entryFree id="n14445" type="main" key="dissu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dissūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from dissuo.</entryFree>
distabesco: <entryFree id="n14446" type="main" key="dista_besco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-tābesco</orth>, <itype>bŭi, 3</itype>, <sense id="n14446.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to consume</hi> or <hi rend="ital">melt away</hi> (ante- and post-class.). </sense><sense id="n14446.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">distabescit sal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:24" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 24</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">jecur in coquendo, Fest. S. V. MONSTRA, p. 157, 14 Müll.: suspirium in aqua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> Vet. 1, 11, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14446.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quantas iniquitates distabui!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 3:3" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 3, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
distaedet: <entryFree id="n14447" type="main" key="distaedet"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-taedet</orth>, ‡ tisum (acc. to Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=72:18" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 72, 18</bibl>), 2, <sense id="n14447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. impers.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be very tired of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disgusted with</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to loathe</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">haud quod tui me neque domi distaedeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me cum hoc ipso distaedet loqui,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 5, 8, 22</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
distantia: <entryFree id="n14448" type="main" key="distanti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">distantĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>disto</etym>, <sense id="n14448.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">distance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remoteness.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14448.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">a longissimis distantiae suae (sc. Veneris) finibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 15, 12, § 61</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n14448.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a separation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opening</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oris hiscens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:5:50" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 5, 50</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n14448.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">difference</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diversity</hi>: inter eos morum studiorumque, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:20:74" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 20, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">caloris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:10:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 10, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">condicionis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetatis vel sexus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 31, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">personarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 1, 17</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">coloris rufi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:26:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 26, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
distectus: <entryFree id="n14449" type="main" key="distectus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-tectus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dis and tego</etym>, <sense id="n14449.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">uncovered</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> Avit. 4, 408</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
distegus: <entryFree id="n14450" type="gloss" key="diste^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">di-stĕgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">di/stegos</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n14450.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of two stories</hi>, <hi rend="ital">having two apartments</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">armarium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4549</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">distĕ-gum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. armarium), <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 292, 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
distendo: <entryFree id="n14451" type="main" key="distendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-tendo</orth> (and vulg. <orth extent="full" lang="la">distenno</orth>), <itype>di, tum</itype> (in late Lat. also distensus, Coripp. Joann. 7, 324; but in Auct. B. Alex. 45, 2, the right reading is dispersis), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n14451.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to stretch asunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stretch out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend</hi> (not freq. till after the Aug. per.; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n14451.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">dispennite hominem divorsum et distennite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 5, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Tityos novem Jugeribus distentus erat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 458</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brachia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:491" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 491</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus temonibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:19" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: aciem, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:92:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 92, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">copias hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Oth. 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in currus distentum illigat Mettum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 28</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">utramque manum in latus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:114" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 114</bibl></cit>: pontem in agros, Lue. 4, 140.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi> in mid. force: <cit><quote lang="la">haec per octoginta sex milia distenduntur,</quote> <trans><tr>extend</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 661</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14451.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14451.3" n="1" level="3"> (Effectus pro causa.) <hi rend="ital">To swell out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distend</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to fill</hi>, e. g. with food: <cit><quote lang="la">ventres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubera cytiso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 31</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ubera lacte,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 21</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and transf.: capellas lacte,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ducem (i. e. bovem) denso pingui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 3, 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cellas nectare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:433" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 433</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">horrea plena spicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:84" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 84</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14451.4" n="2" level="3"> (Causa pro effectu.) <hi rend="ital">To torture</hi> by distention: <cit><quote lang="la">tormento aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:62" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 62</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,019:11:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Heb. 11, 35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14451.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut in duo pariter bella curas hominum,</quote> <trans><tr>to divide</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">curam vilicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:46:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 46, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedulitatem vilici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos,</quote> <trans><tr>to distract</tr>, <tr>perplex</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,030:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccl. 3, 10</bibl>.— Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">distentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> (acc. to I. B. 1.), <hi rend="ital">distended</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">filled up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:46" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 46</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">distentum cruribus uber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:826" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 826</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">distentius uber,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">distentus ac madens,</quote> <trans><tr>stuffed full</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:33" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 33</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:49:6" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 49, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
distenno: <entryFree id="n14452" type="main" key="distenno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">distenno</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. distendo <sense id="n14452.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
distensus: <entryFree id="n14453" type="main" key="distensus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">distensus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. distendo <sense id="n14453.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
distentio: <entryFree id="n14454" type="main" key="distenti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">distentĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>distendo</etym>, <sense id="n14454.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stretching out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distention</hi> (very rare), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 89" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 89</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14454.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">fullness</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">occupation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,030:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccl. 8, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
distentus: <entryFree id="n14455" type="main" key="distentus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">distentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from distendo.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n14456" type="main" key="distentus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">distentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from distineo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n14457" type="hapax" key="distentus3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">distentus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>distendo</etym>, <sense id="n14457.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a swelling out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distention</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">subflatae cutis distentu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 38, 57, § 138</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
disterminatio: <entryFree id="n14458" type="main" key="distermi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">distermĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n14458.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a separation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">division</hi>, Simplic. p. 83 Goes.</sense></entryFree>
disterminator: <entryFree id="n14459" type="hapax" key="distermi^na_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">distermĭnātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>distermino</etym>,<cb n="DIST" />  <sense id="n14459.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a separator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divider</hi>: axis disterminator mundi, App. de Mundo, p. 57.</sense></entryFree>
distermino: <entryFree id="n14460" type="main" key="distermi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-termĭno</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n14460.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to separate by a boundary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to divide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">limit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">part</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">mostly post-Aug.): quas (sterlas) intervallum binas disterminat unum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=94" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hispanias Galliasque Pyrenaei montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">communibus parietibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:10:1:4:section=10 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 10, 1, 4, § 10 al.</bibl></cit>—With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arabia Judaeam ab Aegypto disterminat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 21, 45, § 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vettones ab Asturia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 20, 34, § 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallica arva ab Ausoniis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Asiam ab Europa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:957" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 957</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14460.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to limit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regulate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea res ratio disterminat omnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:719" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 719</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
disterminus: <entryFree id="n14461" type="main" key="distermi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">distermĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>dis-terminus</etym>, <sense id="n14461.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">separated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divided</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tartessos latis distermina terris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:5:399" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 5, 399</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14461.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">parting.</hi>—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">distermĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. linea), <hi rend="ital">the diameter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diagonal</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 6, § 714</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
disterno: <entryFree id="n14462" type="main" key="disterno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">di-sterno</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n14462.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to spread out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to make</tr>, <tr>prepare</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 256, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra limen pueris distratum fuerat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2</bibl></cit>, p. 121, 25.</sense></entryFree>
distero: <entryFree id="n14463" type="main" key="diste^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-tĕro</orth>, <itype>trīvi, trītum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n14463.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to bruise</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grind to pieces.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n14463.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">caseum in mortario,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:75" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 75</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n14463.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem clunibus basiisque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 24, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
distexo: <entryFree id="n14464" type="main" key="distexo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-texo</orth>, <itype>ĕre, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n14464.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to unravel</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ravel out</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> C. 15, 161</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
distichus: <entryFree id="n14465" type="greek" key="disti^chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">distĭchus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">di/stixos</foreign>, <sense id="n14465.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consisting of two rows.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14465.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hordeum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:9:16" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 9, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14465.2" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n14465.3" n="A" level="2"> ‡ <orth extent="full" lang="la">distĭ-chum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a building with two stories</hi> or <hi rend="ital">two rows of chambers</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> p. 627</bibl>, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 234.—</sense><sense id="n14465.4" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">distĭchon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a poem of two verses</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a distich</hi> consisting of a hexameter and a pentameter, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:29:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 29, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=otho:3 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oth. 3 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
distillo: <entryFree id="n14466" type="main" key="distillo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">distillo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, v. destillo.</entryFree>
distimulo: <entryFree id="n14467" type="hapax" key="disti^mu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">di-stĭmŭlo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n14467.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to goad through;</hi> transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bona,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to run through</tr>, <tr>waste</tr>, <tr>consume</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 1, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
distincte: <entryFree id="n14468" type="main" key="distincte"><orth extent="full" lang="la">distincte</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n14468.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">distinctly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clearly; handsomely</hi>, etc., v. distinguo, <hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
distinctio: <entryFree id="n14469" type="main" key="distincti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">distinctĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>distinguo</etym>. <sense id="n14469.0" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to distinguo, I. B.) </sense><sense id="n14469.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n14469.2" n="1" level="3"> Subject., <hi rend="ital">a distinguishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discriminating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a distinction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">harum rerum facilis est et expedita distinctio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:10:33" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 10, 33</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">facilis ingenui et illiberalis jocis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">justorum injustorumque (lex),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 2, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veri a falso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaestionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:5:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 5, 6</bibl></cit> et saep.— </sense><sense id="n14469.3" n="2" level="3"> Object., <hi rend="ital">a difference</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">causarum distinctio ac dissimilitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:chapter=19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 19</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">volucrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 11, 13, § 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae distinctio sit inter ea, quae gignantur, et ea, quae sint semper eadem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla in visis distinctio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:2:44" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 2, 44</bibl>.—Pregn.: <cit><quote lang="la">lunae siderumque omnium distinctio, varietas, pulchritudo, ordo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the differences in their appearance and motions</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:5:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 5, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14469.4" n="B" level="2"> In rhet. and gram. </sense><sense id="n14469.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A separation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">division</hi>, in discourse; <cit><quote lang="la">and concr.,</quote> <trans><tr>a mark of separation</tr>, <tr>sign of interpunction</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:48:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 48, 186</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 27</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 432</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n14469.6" n="2" level="3"> A figure of speech, <hi rend="ital">separation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinction</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:54:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 54, 206</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:65" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 65</bibl>; esp. <hi rend="ital">the contrast of opposing ideas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:82" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 82</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">the parting of opposing voices</hi> or <hi rend="ital">votes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 14, 6</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n14469.7" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to distinguo, II.) <hi rend="ital">A setting off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">garnishing; an ornament</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">distinctio honosque civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 3, 3, § 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
distinctor: <entryFree id="n14470" type="main" key="distinctor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">distinctor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14470.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who distinguishes</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">justorum injustorumque (judices),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">18, 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Joann. 20:12" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Joann. 20, 12</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
distinctus: <entryFree id="n14471" type="main" key="distinctus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">distinctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from distinguo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n14472" type="main" key="distinctus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">distinctus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>distinguo</etym>, <sense id="n14472.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a distinguishing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinction;</hi> object., <hi rend="ital">a difference</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): distinctu pinnarum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 28</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:5:41" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 5, 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
distineo: <entryFree id="n14473" type="main" key="disti^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-tĭnĕo</orth>, <itype>tĭnŭi, tentum, 2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>teneo</etym>. <sense id="n14473.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To keep asunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divide.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14473.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigna binis utrimque fibulis ab extrema parte distinebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:17:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 17, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare, quod late terrarum distinet oras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 203</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:690" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 690</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo freta Isthmos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:8:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 8, 69</bibl></cit> Heins.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:12:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:675" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 675</bibl>: quem Notus spatio longius annuo Dulci distinet a domo,<pb n="598" /> <cb n="DIST" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 5, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14473.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to divide mentally; to distract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perplex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">distineor et divellor dolore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:33:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 33, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duae factiones senatum distinebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 16, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 20, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unanimos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ancipiti bello distinere regem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 20</bibl></cit>. —Esp. freq., </sense><sense id="n14473.3" n="II" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to hold off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep back</hi>, <hi rend="ital">keep asunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hinder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">detain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prevent; to occupy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">employ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divert</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones a praesidio interclusas maximum flumen distinebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:59:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 59, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus hostium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 11, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:52:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 52, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">copias Caesaris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 44, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Volscos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parthos Hyrcano bello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Britannicum militem hoste et mari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 32</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">in multitudine judiciorum et novis legibus distineri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 30, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">distineri litibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:9:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 9, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad omnia tuenda multifariam distineri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quominus strueret crimina distineri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14473.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanimate objects: <cit><quote lang="la">pacem,</quote> <trans><tr>to hinder</tr>, <tr>prevent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:12:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 12, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">victoriam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 37, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 12</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">distentus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">engaged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">busied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">occupied</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tot tantisque negotiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 8, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:3:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 3, 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:18:1 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 18, 1 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">te distentissimum esse qua de Buthrotiis, qua de Bruto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 15, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa summa scelera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—Of abstract subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">mens divina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 39 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus distentum impeditumque maximis officiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 5, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> and <pos>adv.</pos> seem not to occur.</sense></entryFree>
distinguo: <entryFree id="n14474" type="main" key="distinguo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">di-stinguo</orth>, <itype>nxi, nctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root in Sanscr. tegami, to be sharp; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sti/zw, sti/gma</foreign>; Lat. stimulus stilus, in-stigare, etc.</etym>. —Prop., to separate by points; hence, in gen., <sense id="n14474.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">part.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14474.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (very rare, and almost exclusively <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">onus inclusum numero eodem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crinem docta manu,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to arrange</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 884" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 884</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">meton.: caput acu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Nupt. Hon. 284</bibl></cit>.—Of countries: <cit><quote lang="la">qui locus Bithyniam et Galatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 10</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq. and class. (not in Caes.), </sense><sense id="n14474.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to distinguish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discriminate</hi>, = discernere. </sense><sense id="n14474.3" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">ea (crimina) distinguere ac separare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 41</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">with dividere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:28:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 28, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servos numero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 20</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cadentes guttas intervallis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:48:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 48, 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratorum genera aetatibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">status familiarum agnationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 1, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua via ambigua distinguantur, ostendit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:41:152" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 41, 152</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:4:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 4, 16</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">secernenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:7:31" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 7, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genera causarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:68" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 68</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">fortes ignavosque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">veri similia ab incredibilibus dijudicare et distinguere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vera somnia a falsis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Vargulam a Crasso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:60:244" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 60, 244</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artificem ab inscio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluntatem a facto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">thesin a causa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:5:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 5, 11</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">vero falsum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simiarum genera caudis inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:54:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 54, 80</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid inter naturam et rationem intersit, non distinguitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:10:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 10, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <hi rend="ital">malus</hi> arborem significet an hominem non bonum, apice distinguitur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:7:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuntiatum Claudio perisse Messalinam, non distincto sua an aliena manu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 38</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14474.4" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n14474.5" n="(a)" level="5"> In rhet. and gram., <hi rend="ital">to mark the pauses in discourse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to punctuate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer ut sciat, quo loco versum distinguere debeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:8:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 8, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">eam (orationem) distinguent atque concident,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:2:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 27</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">incidit has (sc. voces) et distinxit in partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 3, 2</bibl></cit> Mos.: <cit><quote lang="la">distinctio est silentii nota, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 432</bibl></cit> P.—</sense><sense id="n14474.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To end</hi>, <hi rend="ital">terminate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">contationem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 127 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense><sense id="n14474.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To set off</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decorate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adorn</hi> (most freq. in the <pos>P. a.</pos>). </sense><sense id="n14474.8" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">racemos purpureo colore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 5, 11</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">poma vario colore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Nux, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum gemmarum nitor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 573" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 573</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 62, § 171</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n14474.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem variare et distinguere quasi quibusdam verborum sententiarumque insignibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 9, 36</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of discourse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:15:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 15, 49</bibl></cit> (with illustrare); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatem (with variare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:11:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 11, 38</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">coenam comoedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">distinctus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n14474.10" n="A" level="2"> (Acc. to I.) <hi rend="ital">Separated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinct</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbs delubris distincta spatiisque communibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 26</bibl></cit>: Romana acies distinctior, ex pluribus<cb n="DIST" />  partibus constans, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hesiodus circa CXX. annos distinctus ab Homeri aetate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:7" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concentus ex distinctis sonis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 42</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">distinctos dignitatis gradus non habebat (civitas),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 27</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—</sense><sense id="n14474.11" n="2" level="3"> Of discourse, <hi rend="ital">properly divided</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 35</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n14474.12" n="B" level="2"> (Acc. to II.) <hi rend="ital">Decorated</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adorned</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pocula gemmis distincta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">distinctum et ornatum caelum astris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lyra gemmis et dentibus Indis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 167</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbae innumeris floribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:266" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 266</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retia maculis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 5, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14474.13" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio et ornata et artificio quodam et expolitione distincta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 12</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of discourse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:33" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 33</bibl></cit>; and transf., of the speaker himself: utroque genere creber et distinctus <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, Cic. Brut. 17 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. in <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 18</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">distincte</orth>. </sense><sense id="n14474.14" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to I.) <hi rend="ital">Distinctly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">clearly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">articulatim distincteque dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:13:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 13, 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">designare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:88:6" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 88, 6</bibl></cit>.—In the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">enuntiare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 7, 13</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">distinctissime persuadere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Complex ad Ephes. 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14474.15" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to II.) <hi rend="ital">Elegantly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">handsomely</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui distincte, qui explicate, qui abundanter, qui illuminate et rebus et verbis dicunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:14:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 14, 53</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 1, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">distinctius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:3:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 3, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
distisum: <entryFree id="n14475" type="gloss" key="disti_sum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">distīsum</orth>, v. distaedet.</entryFree>
disto: <entryFree id="n14476" type="main" key="disto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">di-sto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype> (<sense id="n14476.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi> distiti, only Boëth. in Porphyr. 4, p. 89), <pos>v. n.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to stand apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distant</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n14476.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (cf. absum), <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum summa labra (fossae) distabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:72:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 72, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 17, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:27:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 27, 67</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 241</bibl> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">inter se</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">turres pedes LXXX. inter se distant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 72 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trabes inter se binos pedes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 23, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 2, 10, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter se modicum spatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum sidera inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:24:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 24, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastati inter se modicum spatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8</bibl></cit> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">a</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(imago) distare a speculo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:289" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 289</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">castra ab castris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:82:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 82, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra ab hujus terrae continuatione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:66 al" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 66 al.</bibl></cit>—With simple <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum tanto Phrygiā Gallica distet humus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:362" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 362</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 3, 145</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also: foro nimium distare Carinas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:715" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 715</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n14476.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of remoteness in time: <cit><quote lang="la">non multum aetate distantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non multum inter se distantes tempore, ib. § 11: quantum distet ab Inacho Codrus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud multum distanti tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 24</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n14476.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, of quality, <hi rend="ital">to differ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be different</hi>=differre, discrepare (freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">ut distare aliquid aut ex aliqua parte differre videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:chapter=14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quia res differebant, nomina rerum distare voluerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:8:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 8, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moribus et legibus distant (civitates),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:40" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:4:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 4, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in totum metaphora brevior est similitudo, eoque distat, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 6, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum inter se distant istae facultates longeque sunt diversae atque sejunctae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:49:215" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 49, 215</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum inter se genera dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:16:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 16, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum vita tantum distat a victu et cultu bestiarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:4:15" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 4, 15</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">ab</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 17, 71</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:15:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc.
