Am. 15, 44</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:65:263" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 65, 263</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:114" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:2:11 al" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 2, 11 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quid enim tam distans quam a severitate comitas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:10:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 10, 34</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">infido scurrae distabit amicus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">paulum sepultae inertiae celata virtus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 4, 9, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid aera lupinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pulchra et exactis minimum distantia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">enthymema syllogismo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:7 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 7 al.</bibl></cit>— <hi rend="ital">Impers.</hi>: distat, <hi rend="ital">there is a difference</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">distat, sumasne pudenter An rapias,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 17, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 195</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:210" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 210</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:26" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
distorqueo: <entryFree id="n14477" type="main" key="distorque^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-torquĕo</orth>, <itype>rsi, rtum</itype> (<sense id="n14477.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">supine</hi>, distorsum acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 871</bibl> P.), <itype>2</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to turn different ways</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to twist</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distort</hi> (rare but class.). </sense><sense id="n14477.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">os,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 3</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ora cachinno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:287" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 287</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 11, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14477.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to torment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torture.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14477.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:19" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 19</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14477.4" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem repulsa distorqueat (with amore cruciari),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 74" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitationem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 52, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">distortus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <cb n="DIST" /> <hi rend="ital">distorted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">misshapen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deformed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dwarfish.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14477.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">distortus ejecta lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:66:266" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 66, 266</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:83" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:5:11" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 5, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:29" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solos sapientes esse, si distortissimi sint, formosos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:29:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 29, 61</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:21" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 21</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pumili atque distorti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:83" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 83</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14477.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum (genus enuntiandi) distortius,</quote> <trans><tr>more perverse</tr>, <tr>unseemly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:chapter=8" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 8</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Adv.</hi> does not occur.</sense></entryFree>
distorsio: <entryFree id="n14478" type="main" key="distorsi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">distorsĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>distorqueo</etym>, <sense id="n14478.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perversion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perverse conduct</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 66:7" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 66, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
distortio: <entryFree id="n14479" type="main" key="distorti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">distortĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14479.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a distorting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">writhing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contortion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">membrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:13:29" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 13, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:12:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 12, 35</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 4, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
distortus: <entryFree id="n14480" type="main" key="distortus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">distortus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from distorqueo.</entryFree>
distractio: <entryFree id="n14481" type="main" key="distracti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">distractĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>distraho</etym>, <sense id="n14481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pulling asunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dividing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separating.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14481.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n14481.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">distractio cruciatusque membrorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:5:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 5, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14481.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a parting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dividing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanorum animorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:11:27" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi corporisque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 30" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harum mihi voluptatum omnium atque itidem tibi distractio, discidium, vastities venit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 68</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14481.4" n="C" level="2"> In partic., in mercant. lang., <hi rend="ital">a selling in single portions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">piecemeal</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">by retail</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">fundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:15:8:section=15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 15, 8, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:14:3:5:section=12" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 14, 3, 5, § 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14481.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">dissension</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discord</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disagreement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla nobis societas cum tyrannis et potius summa distractio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:6:32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 6, 32</bibl></cit>; so, civium, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 287, 15</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
distractor: <entryFree id="n14482" type="main" key="distractor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">distractor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id. I.</etym>. <sense id="n14482.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who worries</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a tormenter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">improbus (i. e. Achilles),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Anthol. Lat.</author> 1, 93, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14482.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A retailer</hi>, Cod. Th. 11, 1, 4: <cit><quote lang="la">argenti,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a money-changer</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Just. 8, 14, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12, 35 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
distractus: <entryFree id="n14483" type="main" key="distractus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">distractus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from distraho.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n14484" type="hapax" key="distractus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">distractus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>distraho</etym>, <sense id="n14484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dissolution of a contract</hi>, opp. to contractus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Inst. 3:27:section=6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Inst. 3, 27, § 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
distraho: <entryFree id="n14485" type="main" key="distra^ho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-trăho</orth>, <itype>xi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n14485.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To pull asunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tear in pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to separate forcibly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divide</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n14485.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14485.2" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus quod dirimi distrahive non possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 12</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:29:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 29, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exanimor, feror, differor, distrahor, diripior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; Pentheum diripuisse aiunt Bacchas; <cit><quote lang="la">nugas ... prae quo pacto ego divorsus distrahor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:4:1 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 2, 4, 1 sq.</bibl></cit>; cf.: Mettum Fufetium equis ad curriculum ex utraque parte deligatum distraxit, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 287, 22</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of the same: corpus passim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of Hippolytus: turbatis distractus equis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:787" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 787</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae (materia) neque perrumpi neque distrahi potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vallum (with diripere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut aciem ejus distrahi paterentur,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to be separated</tr>, <tr>broken up</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:92:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 92, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Taurus mons mediam distrahens Asiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 27, § 97</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14485.3" n="2" level="3"> In partic., in mercant. lang., <hi rend="ital">to sell separately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in parcels</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to retail</hi> = divendere (mostly post-Aug.): dividant, differant, dissipent, distrahant, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 287, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">coëmendo quaedam tantum ut pluris postea distraheret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:16" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">fundum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:15:8:section=15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 15, 8, § 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">merces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:1:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bona venum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 19</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14485.4" n="(b)" level="5"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to sell</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">instrumentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Cal. 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levi pretio aetatulam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 191 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n14485.5" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To waste</hi>, <hi rend="ital">squander</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apsenti hic tua res distrahitur tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 1, 16</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n14485.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to draw in different directions; to divide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distract</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perplex</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui haec natura cohaerentia opinione distraxissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:3:11" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 3, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:3:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 3, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">distrahitur in deliberando animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 3, 9</bibl></cit>; cf., shortly before: in quo considerando saepe animi in contrarias sententias distrahuntur; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">distrahor, tum hoc mihi probabilius, tum illud videtur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Tiberium anceps cura distraheret, vine militum ... an, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 44</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsessos hinc fides, inde egestas inter decus ac flagitium distrahebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratoris industriam in plura studia distrahere nolim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic distrahuntur in contrarias partes impotentium cupiditates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 40</bibl>: res publica <pb n="599" /> <cb n="DIST" /> distracta lacerataque, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 57</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">quae sententia omnem societatem distrahit civitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:6:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 6, 28</bibl></cit>: Caesarem et Pompeium perfidia hominum distractos in pristinam concordiam reducere, Balbus ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 15</bibl> A.: <cit><quote lang="la">amorem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 3, 2, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">concilium Boeotorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collegia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrimonium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:24:2:2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 24, 2, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">rem,</quote> <trans><tr>to frustrate</tr>, <tr>prevent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 33, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">controversias, i. e. dirimere,</quote> <trans><tr>to end</tr>, <tr>adjust</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 2, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:85" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 85</bibl>: voces, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to leave a hiatus</hi> (opp. contrahere), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:45:152" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 45, 152</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua ipse fama distraheretur, i. q. differretur (cf. differo, B. 2.),</quote> <trans><tr>would be assailed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n14485.7" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To tear away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">draw away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14485.8" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra divellere ac distrahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illam a me distrahit necessitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 4, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14485.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientiam, temperantiam, fortitudinem copulatas esse docui cum voluptate, ut ab ea nullo modo nec divelli nec distrahi possint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:16:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 16, 50</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14485.10" n="2" level="3"> Of persons, <hi rend="ital">to separate in sentiment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to estrange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alienate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ab aliquo (preceded by: a conjunctione avocare, and: a familiaritate disjungere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 10, 23</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with divellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:42:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 42, 102</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">distractus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n14485.11" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Divided</hi> (very rarely): <cit><quote lang="la">(conjectus animaï) divisior inter se ac distractior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:961" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 961</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14485.12" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">distracted</hi>, <hi rend="ital">perplexed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">distractissimus tantorum onerum mole,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:114:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 114, 1</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> does not occur.</sense></entryFree>
distribuo: <entryFree id="n14486" type="main" key="distri^bu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-trĭbŭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n14486.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to divide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distribute</hi> (class.; cf.: divido, impertio, dispenso, participo, communico). </sense><sense id="n14486.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">partiendum sibi ac latius distribuendum exercitum putavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">distribuisti partes Italiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 4, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 4, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">reliquum populum distribuit in quinque classes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 22</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:84" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">copias in tres partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:32:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 32, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:55:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 55, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pueros in classes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orbem in duodecim partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 28</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">milites circum familias conventus Campani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiatorias familias Capuam et in cetera municipia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Numidas in hiberna in proximis Thessalis urbibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones et auxilia provinciatim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:49" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites in legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 4:1:43" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 4, 1, 43</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladiatores binos singulis patribus familiarum,</quote> <trans><tr>distributed among them</tr>, <tr>apportioned to them</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:14:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 14, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves quaestori, legatis, praefectis, equitibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 22, 3</bibl></cit> and 5: <cit><quote lang="la">equos Germanis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 65</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunias exercitui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:39:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 39, 3 al.</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: pecuniam in judices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:27:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 27, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves in legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecus viritim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:71:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 71, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capita singula ex captivis toto exercitu praedae nomine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 89</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Poenorum arma inter suos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 4:7:12" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 4, 7, 12</bibl></cit> et saep. Rarely of the distributing of a service among several: <cit><quote lang="la">alterum (genus) emendi, quod praeterea civitatibus aequaliter esset distributum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 70</bibl></cit> Zumpt. —</sense><sense id="n14486.2" n="II" level="1"> Of abstract objects: <cit><quote lang="la">quae observata sunt in usu ac tractatione dicendi, haec partibus distributa sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:23:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 23, 109</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:93" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 93</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:1:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 1, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">meministis me ita distribuisse initio causam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae opera hac (honesti) regulā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 7:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 7, 2</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">distrĭ-būte</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">orderly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">methodically</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">neque distincte neque distribute scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">distributius tractare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:59:177" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 59, 177</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
distributio: <entryFree id="n14487" type="main" key="distri^bu_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">distrĭbūtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>distribuo</etym>, <sense id="n14487.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a division</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distribution.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14487.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">invidiae et criminum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:chapter=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utilis rerum ac partium in locos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:1:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. 2, 7</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n14487.2" n="II" level="1"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n14487.3" n="A" level="2"> As a fig. of speech, the resolution of a statement or idea into several, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:53:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 53, 203</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 35, 47</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14487.4" n="B" level="2"> In arch., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
distributivus: <entryFree id="n14488" type="main" key="distri^bu_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">distrĭbūtīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14488.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">apportioning</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distributive</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1112</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
distributor: <entryFree id="n14489" type="main" key="distri^bu_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">distrĭbūtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n14489.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a distributer</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Trism. p. 92, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
distributrix: <entryFree id="n14490" type="main" key="distri^bu_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">distrĭbūtrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>distributor</etym>, <sense id="n14490.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who apportions</hi> or <hi rend="ital">distributes</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Didym. de Spir. Sanc. 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> <cb n="DIST" /></sense></entryFree>
distributus: <entryFree id="n14491" type="main" key="distri^bu_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">distrĭbūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from distribuo.</entryFree>
districte: <entryFree id="n14492" type="main" key="districte"><orth extent="full" lang="la">districte</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">districtim</orth>, <sense id="n14492.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">advv.</hi>, v. distringo, <hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">a</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>.</sense></entryFree>
districtio: <entryFree id="n14493" type="main" key="districti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">districtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>distringo</etym>. <sense id="n14493.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a stretching out</hi>, as a punishment, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 3, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">47</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14493.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a hindrance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">difficulty</hi>, Ambros. de Job, 3, 4, 12; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:8:16" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 8, 16</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
districtivus: <entryFree id="n14494" type="main" key="districti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">districtīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. In medic., <sense id="n14494.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pertaining to dissolving</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adjutoria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:2:20" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 2, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:2:29:159" default="NO">2, 29, 159</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
districtus: <entryFree id="n14495" type="main" key="districtus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">districtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from distringo.</entryFree>
distrigilla: <entryFree id="n14496" type="gloss" key="distri_gilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">distrīgilla</orth> <itype>me</itype>, <foreign lang="greek">peri/cuso/n me</foreign>, Gloss. Lat. Gr.</entryFree>
distringo: <entryFree id="n14497" type="main" key="distringo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">di-stringo</orth>, <itype>nxi, ctum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <sense id="n14497.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To draw asunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stretch out</hi> (very rarely): radiis rotarum districti pendent, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:616" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 616</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(canum) rabies districta,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>showing the teeth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1064" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1064</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">acies dentium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 7, 13</bibl></cit>.—Far more freq., esp. since the Aug. per. (not in Caesar, and in Cicero only as <pos>P. a.</pos>), </sense><sense id="n14497.1" n="II" level="1"> (Like distineo, II.) <hi rend="ital">To detain</hi> a person anywhere, <hi rend="ital">to hinder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to occupy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engage</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanum a tergo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:13:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem (i. e. Romanos) incendiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">distringit quem multarum rerum varietas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 26, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 26, 65, § 239</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">distringor officio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 7:15:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 15, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:5" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Jovem) votis,</quote> <trans><tr>to molest</tr>, <tr>importune</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:94:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 94, 2</bibl></cit>.—Esp. as milit. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to make a diversion against</hi> an enemy, <hi rend="ital">to distract the attention of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibalem mittendum in Africam esse ad distringendos Romanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copias regias populatione maritimae orae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 35</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Scipionem oppugnatione plurium oppidorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:3:5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14497.2" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To puzzle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">confound</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut distrinxi hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:5:1:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 5, 1, 65</bibl></cit> (Spengel, destrinxi).—</sense><sense id="n14497.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of abstract objects: <cit><quote lang="la">ut discordiam moveret, qua consensus Romanorum distringeretur,</quote> <trans><tr>would be hindered</tr>, <tr>disturbed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Strat. 1:8:1" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Strat. 1, 8, 1</bibl></cit> Oud. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">districtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n14497.4" n="A" level="2"> (Qs. stretched tight, i. e.) <hi rend="ital">Strict</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severe</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">districtior accusator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feneratrix (opp. amica obsequens),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:2:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">censura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:9:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">districtissimi defensores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 55, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14497.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Divided in mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at strife with one's self;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">hesitating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vacillating</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">districtus mihi videris esse, quod et bonus civis et bonus amicus es,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:15:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 15, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14497.6" n="C" level="2"> More freq. and class., <hi rend="ital">occupied</hi>, <hi rend="ital">engaged</hi>, <hi rend="ital">busy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicio districtus atque obligatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:chapter=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">(vinculo mortali) alii alligati sunt, alii astricti, alii districti quoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 16" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ancipiti contentione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labore vita districta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Ep. ad Tryph. 1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Ep. ad Tryph. 1</bibl>; * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 68</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Hann. 13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Hann. 13, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">imperium circa mala sua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:1" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 12, 1</bibl></cit>; and in the <hi rend="ital">comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam me a causis et judiciis districtiorem fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 16</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> acc. to A., <hi rend="ital">strictly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">severely.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14497.7" n="(a)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">districte</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">des-</orth>): <cit><quote lang="la">minatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:9:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 9, 21, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deneganda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:3:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 3, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14497.8" n="(b)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">districtim</orth>: <cit><quote lang="la">innocens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14497.9" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">districtius: repercutere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Idol. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vivere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 22</bibl></cit>, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 11.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 9, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
distrunco: <entryFree id="n14498" type="hapax" key="distrunco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-trunco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n14498.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cut to pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cut up</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego te hic agnum faciam, et medium distruncabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:2:7:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 2, 7, 53</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
disturbatio: <entryFree id="n14499" type="main" key="disturba_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">disturbātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>disturbo</etym>, <sense id="n14499.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">destruction.</hi> * </sense><sense id="n14499.1" n="I" level="1"> Prop.: <cit><quote lang="la">Corinthi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:11:46" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 11, 46</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14499.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, Mythogr. Vatic. in Mai. Auct. Class. 3, p. 85 b.</sense></entryFree>
disturbo: <entryFree id="n14500" type="main" key="disturbo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dis-turbo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n14500.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to drive asunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to separate by violence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to throw into disorder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturb.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14500.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14500.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (rarely): <cit><quote lang="la">vidistis contionem gladiis disturbari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sortes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:34" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">freta (Auster),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 1012" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 1012</bibl></cit>. —Far more freq. and class. (but not in the Aug. poets), </sense><sense id="n14500.3" n="B" level="2"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to demolish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi> (esp. freq. of buildings): <cit><quote lang="la">aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1102</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">domos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:241" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 241</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domum meam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 7, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:587" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 587</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">porticum Catuli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 3</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis cuncta disturbat ac dissipat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:15:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 15, 41</bibl></cit>: opera, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 26, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si qua in vineis fossor disturbavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:38" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 38</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n14500.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to frustrate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thwart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ruin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">at nunc disturba quas statuisti machinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 137</bibl></cit>: vitae societatem, Cic. <cb n="DIU" /> Rosc. Am. 38, 111; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">concordiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. Fragm. 1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. Fragm. 1, 19</bibl></cit> ed. Gerl. (Orat. L. Philippi); so, <cit><quote lang="la">disturbare atque pervertere legem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:37:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 37, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">judicium tollere ac disturbare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 5, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 25, 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem,</quote> <trans><tr>to hinder</tr>, <tr>prevent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 11, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">nuptias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 2, 11</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
disunio: <entryFree id="n14501" type="hapax" key="di^su_ni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭs-ūnĭo</orth>, <itype>īre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n14501.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to disunite</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nexus matrimoniorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 3, p. 116</bibl></cit> (p. 145 ed. Oehler).</sense></entryFree>
disyllabus: <entryFree id="n14502" type="greek" key="di^sylla^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭsyllăbus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">disu/llabos</foreign>, <sense id="n14502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dissyllabic</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 26, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:31" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1518,001:page=2431" default="NO"><author>Ter. Maur.</author> p. 2431</bibl> P.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭsyllăbae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype> (sc. voces), <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">dissyllabic words</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissyllables</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 269</bibl>; also, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭsyllăba</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype> (sc. verba), <gen>n.</gen>, the same, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, § 521 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
ditator: <entryFree id="n14503" type="hapax" key="di_ta_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dītātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>dito</etym>, <sense id="n14503.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one that enriches</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 5:5" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 5, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ditesco: <entryFree id="n14504" type="main" key="di_tesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dītesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n14504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [dis=dives], <hi rend="ital">to grow rich</hi> (a <usg type="style">poet.</usg> word): <cit><quote lang="la">praeda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1249" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1249</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:6:14" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 6, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qua ratione queas ditescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:5:10 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 5, 10 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n14504.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">partu dulci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1245</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 2, 396 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
dithalassus: <entryFree id="n14505" type="greek" key="di^tha^lassus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭthălassus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">diqa/lassos</foreign>, Lat. bimaris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,005:27:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Act. 27, 41</bibl>.</entryFree>
dithyrambicus: <entryFree id="n14506" type="greek" key="di_thy^rambi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīthyrambĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">diqurambiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n14506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dithyrambic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">poema,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:Or. 1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. Or. 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dithyrambus: <entryFree id="n14507" type="greek" key="di_thy^rambus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīthyrambus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">diqu/rambos</foreign>, <sense id="n14507.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dithyramb</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dithyrambic poem.</hi> Orig. in honor of Bacchus, but afterwards also of other gods; cf. Lidd. and Scott, sub voce <foreign lang="greek">diqu/rambos</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:48:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 48, 145</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 5, § 519</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ditiae: <entryFree id="n14508" type="main" key="di_ti^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dītĭae</orth>, <itype>arum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dis=dives</etym>, <sense id="n14508.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wealth</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:7:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 7, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 2, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ditifico: <entryFree id="n14509" type="main" key="di_ti^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dītĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre</itype> <etym>dis=dives+facio</etym>, <sense id="n14509.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to enrich</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 8, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
ditio: <entryFree id="n14510" type="main" key="di^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>less correct form for dicio</itype>, q. v.</entryFree>
ditius: <entryFree id="n14511" type="main" key="di_tius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dītius</orth>, <sense id="n14511.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv. comp.; sup.</hi>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dītissime</orth>, v. dives <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
dito: <entryFree id="n14512" type="main" key="di_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīto</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype> (an uncontr. form divitant, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:14:1:34" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 14, 1, 34</bibl>, and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 95, 9</bibl>; Trag. v. 169 Rib.; Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 1, 1</bibl>.; Com. v. 198 Rib.), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>dis=dives</etym>, <sense id="n14512.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to enrich</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n14512.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">(urbs) triumphis ditata certissimis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 53, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">socios praemiis belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 54</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">castra militem ditavere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 60 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:31" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:20" default="NO" valid="yes">41, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Galb. 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 18, 58, § 200</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Arabas et Indos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 6, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:60" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 17, 60</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">me benignitas tua Ditavit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:14:23 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 14, 23 al.</bibl>—Mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">rex ipse ditari studebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 57</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14512.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of inanimate objects: <cit><quote lang="la">iter largifica stipe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:628" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 628</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum lingua Catonis et Enni sermonem patrium ditaverit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 57</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
ditrochaeus: <entryFree id="n14513" type="greek" key="di_^tro^chaeus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī^trŏchaeus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ditro/xaios</foreign>, <sense id="n14513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a ditrochee</hi> or <hi rend="ital">double trochee</hi>, ¯˘¯˘, Don. p. 1739 P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 477 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> ib. al.</sense></entryFree>
diu: <entryFree id="n14514" type="main" key="di^u_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭū</orth> (old form dĭūs, Orell. Inscr. 8206), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>old <case>acc.</case> form of duration of time; root in dies; v. Corss. Ausspr. 1, 232 sqq.</etym>. <sense id="n14514.0" n="1" level="3"> (Acc. to dies, I. B. 2.) <hi rend="ital">By day</hi> (very rare), <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 4, 823</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">usually with noctu: noctuque et diu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:4:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 4, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: noctu diuque, Titin. and Sall. H. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 185</bibl> P. (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 2, 54</bibl> Dietsch); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 38:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 38, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:44:5" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:70:1" default="NO" valid="yes">70, 1</bibl>: nec noctu, nec diu, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 98, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diu noctuque iter properabunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctu diuque hostibus obniti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14514.1" n="2" level="3"> (Acc. to dies, II. A. 3.; lit., a space of time, a while; hence, with intens. signif.) <hi rend="ital">A long time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">long while</hi>, <hi rend="ital">long</hi> (freq. in all periods; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">pridem, dudum): nimis diu et longum loquor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 3, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">so with longum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diu multumque scriptitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33:152" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 33, 152</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">diu multumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 13, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:26:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 26, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 94:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 94, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:3:5" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 3, 5</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also: multum diuque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum et diu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:32:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 32, 88</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:19:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 19, 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multum ac diu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 126, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: recordatus multum et diu cogitavi ... Eam rem volutavi et diu disputavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit> and 4: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe et diu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 31, 96</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe diuque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 13, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">diu diuque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 167, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">12</bibl>, p. 266, 16: <cit><quote lang="la">diu atque acriter pugnatum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 21</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">diu ego hunc cruciabo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stoici diu mansuros aiunt animos: semper, negant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1</bibl></cit>. 31 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <pb n="600" /> <cb n="DIUR" /> diu princeps oratorum, aliquando aemulus Ciceronis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam diu restitisti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:2:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 2, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam diu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:2:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 2, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 1, 3, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo, quo jam diu Sum judicatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 1, 20</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">jam diu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 102</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 144</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:5:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 5, 4, 29</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">diu est jam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ille vult diu vivere, hic diu vixit: quamquam, O di boni! quid est in hominis vita diu?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 19, 68</bibl></cit> and 69; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sat diu vixisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nimis diu maceror,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">nimis diu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 1, 54</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 105</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non diu apud hunc servies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:4:4:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 4, 4, 65</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">haud diu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 1, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:2:3:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 2, 3, 67</bibl>.—Followed by <hi rend="ital">dum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">donec</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diu expectare, dum, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> de Rhet. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diu jacere donec, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 45</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">diūtius</orth>, <hi rend="ital">longer</hi> [the <hi rend="ital">t</hi> inserted, as in <hi rend="ital">sectius</hi> and <hi rend="ital">setius</hi> from <hi rend="ital">secus</hi>, being a remnant of adv. ending -ter or -tus]: <cit><quote lang="la">nolo te jactari diutius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:3:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 3, 2, 59</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 1, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 50</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:27:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 27, 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:chapter=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 16, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 26, 1</bibl> et saep.: cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">minus diu quam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 7, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—In the historians freq. = <hi rend="ital">a long while</hi>, <hi rend="ital">very long</hi>, no comparison being intended: <cit><quote lang="la">ne diutius commeatu prohiberetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 9, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 29, 2</bibl>; 4, 35, 2; <cit><quote lang="la">7, 20, 5 et saep.: neque illis, qui victoriam adepti forent, diutius ea uti licuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 39:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 39, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legiones diutius sine consulari fuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 9</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Cato) qui senex diutissime fuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:1:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 1, 4</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:chapter=37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 21, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:14 al" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 14 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut quam diutissime te jucunda opinione oblectarem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with quam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:102:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 102, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14514.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Long since</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a great while ago</hi> (mostly ante-class.): quod arci, diu facti, celeriter corruissent, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 77, 14</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">scelus, inquam, factum'st jam diu antiquom et vetus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 2, 2, 45</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">jam diu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 3, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:19:9 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 19, 9 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: diu jam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 4, 15, § 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">is ex Anactorio ... huc commigravit in Calydonem haud diu,</quote> <trans><tr>not long ago</tr>, <tr>a short time ago</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 5, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec loci gnara sum, nec diu hic fui,</quote> <trans><tr>it is not long since I was here</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 3, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam diu est factum, quom discesti ab hero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 2, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—With foll. quom, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 1, 44</bibl>.— <cit><quote lang="la">With postquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 41</bibl></cit>.—With quod, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 1, 146</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>August.</author> Retract. 1</bibl> Prol.—</sense><sense id="n14514.3" n="C" level="2"> In Mela repeatedly of place, <hi rend="ital">a long way</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Italia ... inter superum mare et inferum excurrit diu solida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:2:4:1" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 2, 4, 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 3, 5</bibl>. Cf. Hand Turs. II. pp. 285-291.</sense></entryFree>
diureticus: <entryFree id="n14515" type="greek" key="di^u_re_ti^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭūrētĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">diourhtiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n14515.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that promotes urine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diuretic</hi> (pure Lat. mictorius or mictualis): <cit><quote lang="la">vina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Oct. 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potiones,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 5, 71 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (3, 72 Bip.): <cit><quote lang="la">medicamenta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 1:4" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 1, 4</bibl></cit>, <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 117.</sense></entryFree>
diurna: <entryFree id="n14516" type="main" key="diurna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">diurna</orth>, <itype>orum</itype>, v. diurnus.</entryFree>
diurnalis: <entryFree id="n14517" type="gloss" key="di^urna_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭurnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>diurna</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">h(merou/sios</foreign>, <sense id="n14517.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">diurnal</hi> (hence, It. <hi rend="ital">giornale;</hi> Fr. <hi rend="ital">journal</hi>), Gloss. Lat. Gr.</sense></entryFree>
diurnarius: <entryFree id="n14518" type="hapax" key="di^urna_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭurnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>diurna</etym>, <sense id="n14518.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a diarykeeper</hi>, <hi rend="ital">journalist</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Theod.</author> 8, 4, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diurne: <entryFree id="n14519" type="main" key="di^urne"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭurne</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. diurnus <sense id="n14519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
diurno: <entryFree id="n14520" type="hapax" key="di^urno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭurno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>diurnus</etym>, <sense id="n14520.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to last long</hi>, <hi rend="ital">exist long</hi>, Quadrig. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:2:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 2, 16</bibl>; and ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 100, 20</bibl> (inusitate dixit pro diu vivere, Gell. l. l.).</sense></entryFree>
diurnus: <entryFree id="n14521" type="main" key="di^urnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭurnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>for dius-nus, from dies; cf.: interdius, quotidianus, etc.</etym>, <sense id="n14521.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the day.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14521.1" n="I" level="1"> In a wider sense, <hi rend="ital">daily</hi> (perh. not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">aetatis fata diurna,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>of only one day</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:6:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 6, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">instituit, ut tam Senatus quam populi diurna acta confierent et publicarentur,</quote> <trans><tr>daily transactions</tr>, <tr>records</tr>, <tr>journal</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:41" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 41</bibl> Oud. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.;</hi> in the same signif.: <cit><quote lang="la">commentarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:64" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 64</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: diurna actorum scriptura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 3</bibl></cit>. (Concerning these acta diurna, v. Lips. Exc. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 5, 4</bibl>; Ernest. Exc. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 20</bibl>; Rupert. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:136" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 136</bibl>; Walch ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:page=114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. p. 114</bibl>, and the art. acta): <cit><quote lang="la">cibus,</quote> <trans><tr>daily allowance</tr>, <tr>rations</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 36 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mercede diurna conductus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 17</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14521.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">diurnum</orth>, <cb n="DIVA" /> <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an account-book</hi>, <hi rend="ital">day-book</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">longum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:482" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 482</bibl></cit>; <number>plur.</number> (sc. acta), <hi rend="ital">diaries</hi>, <hi rend="ital">records</hi>, <hi rend="ital">minutes</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diurna populi Romani, per provincias curatius leguntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 22</bibl></cit>.—Also <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14521.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">diurnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. frumentum), <hi rend="ital">a daily portion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">allowance</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rations</hi> (cf. diarium), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 80:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 80, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 5:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Contr. 5, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:30" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14521.4" n="II" level="1"> In a stricter sense (acc. to dies, I. B. 2.), opp. nocturnus, <hi rend="ital">by day</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of the day</hi> (very freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">diurnum nocturnumve spatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:26:39" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 26, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labores diurni nocturnique,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 23, 82</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">so opp. nocturnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:849" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 849</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:21:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 21, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:21:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 21, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 38 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:2:44" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 2, 44</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 19, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:878" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 878</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">lumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:458" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 458</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:449" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 449</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">stella,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the morning-star</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 1, 2, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">currus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the chariot of the sun</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:629" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 629</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:192" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 192</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nitor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:78 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 18, 78 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actus,</quote> <trans><tr>the day's business</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:78" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 78</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭurne</orth>, <hi rend="ital">daily</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Dracont.</author> Hex. 1, 68</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3, 602</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dius: <entryFree id="n14522" type="main" key="di^us1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. divus.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n14523" type="main" key="dius2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dius</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. diu <sense id="n14523.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
diuscule: <entryFree id="n14524" type="hapax" key="di^uscu^le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭuscŭle</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>diu</etym>, <sense id="n14524.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little while</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Trinit. 11:2" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Trinit. 11, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diutine: <entryFree id="n14525" type="main" key="di^u_ti^ne"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭūtĭne</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, <sense id="n14525.0" n="I" level="1"><xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
diutinus: <entryFree id="n14526" type="main" key="di^u_ti^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭūtĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>diu</etym>, <sense id="n14526.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of long duration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lasting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">long</hi> (rare but class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">longinquus, diuturnus): (supplicium) longum diutinumque a mane ad vesperum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 28</bibl></cit>: mansiones Lemni, *<bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 5, 8, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetatio (opp. longior dolor),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B.
