C. 2, 13, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 14, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conclusio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">militia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morbus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 1</bibl></cit> et saep.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi> do not occur.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">diū-tĭne</orth>, <hi rend="ital">long</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a long time</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:7:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermocinans,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 2, p. 121, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
diutius: <entryFree id="n14527" type="main" key="di^u_ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭūtĭus</orth>, <sense id="n14527.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv. comp.</hi>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭūtissĭme</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv. sup.</hi>, v. diu.</sense></entryFree>
diutule: <entryFree id="n14528" type="main" key="di^u_tu^le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭūtŭle</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>diu</etym>, <sense id="n14528.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little while</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a short time</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:10:7" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 10, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:16:6" default="NO">11, 16, 6</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 7, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">13 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
diuturne: <entryFree id="n14529" type="main" key="di^u_turne"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭūturne</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. diuturnus <sense id="n14529.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
diuturnitas: <entryFree id="n14530" type="main" key="di^u_turni^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭūturnĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>diuturnus</etym>, <sense id="n14530.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">length of time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">long duration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">durability</hi> (good prose). </sense><sense id="n14530.1" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 2, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:27:87" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 27, 87</bibl> (opp. brevitas): <cit><quote lang="la">imperii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:85:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 85, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">otii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 36, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:40:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 40, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 64 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppugnationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:9:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">memoriae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:28:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 28, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14530.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Sen. 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 2, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:12:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 12, 40</bibl> (with longinquitas); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:7:23 al" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 7, 23 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
diuturnus: <entryFree id="n14531" type="main" key="di^u_turnus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dĭūturnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> (diŭ-, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:352" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 352</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>diu</etym>, <sense id="n14531.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of long duration</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lasting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">long</hi> (class.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">diutinus, longinquus): quid putet in rebus humanis diuturnum, qui cognoverit, quid sit aeternum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">gloria (opp. aeterna),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 21</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. extremum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Sen. 19, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">usus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:chapter=22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 22 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 12 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:5:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 5, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:chapter=3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsidio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:352" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 352</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:6:50" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 6, 50</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">status rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 37</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">res publica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 26</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 3: rex,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non potes esse diuturnus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>your power</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:44:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 44, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dux,</quote> <trans><tr>experienced</tr>, <tr>veteran</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equae,</quote> <trans><tr>longerlived</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:7:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 7, 11</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">filia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:219" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 219</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:472" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 3, 472</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">molestiae,</quote> <trans><tr>of longer duration</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:13:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impunitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 14, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 55, 56, § 188</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: poenae diuturnissimae, Aug. Civ. Dei, 21, 23 <hi rend="ital">init.—Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">diūturne</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 10, 5</bibl> Orell. (dub. al. diuturnam).—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diuturnius,</quote> <trans><tr>longer</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">9, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diva: <entryFree id="n14532" type="main" key="di_va"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīva</orth>, ae <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n14532.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a goddess</hi>, v. divus.</sense></entryFree>
divagor: <entryFree id="n14533" type="main" key="di_va^gor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-văgor</orth>, <itype>āri</itype>, <sense id="n14533.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to wander</hi>, <hi rend="ital">wander about</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">animus huc atque illuc,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 4, 3, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 3, 52, § 1 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
divalis: <entryFree id="n14534" type="main" key="di_va_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>divus</etym>. <sense id="n14534.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Divine</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">nomen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Carac. 11, § 7</bibl></cit>; FERIAE DIVALES ANGERONIAE, kept on the <cb n="DIVE" /> 21st of December, Fast. Verrii Fl. ap. Orell. Inscr. II. p. 410; called also DIVALIA, Calend. Maff. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> p. 411</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14534.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Imperial</hi>: constitutiones, Cod. Just. praef. de emend. <hi rend="ital">no.</hi> 4.</sense></entryFree>
divarico: <entryFree id="n14535" type="main" key="di_va_ri^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-vārĭco</orth>, no <sense id="n14535.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> and <gen>n.</gen> </sense><sense id="n14535.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to spread asunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stretch apart</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">taleas super terram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0022,001:45" default="NO"><author>Cato</author> R. R. 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tigna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominem in ea statua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 40</bibl></cit>: divaricatis cruribus, Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 5, 252; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">pedibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 11</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n14535.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to be spread out</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ungulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:5:8" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 5, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
divello: <entryFree id="n14536" type="main" key="di_vello"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-vello</orth>, <itype>velli</itype> (<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 38</bibl>; <sense id="n14536.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">but divulsi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 1173" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 1173</bibl></cit>), <itype>vulsum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> </sense><sense id="n14536.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To rend asunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to tear in pieces</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to separate violently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to tear</hi> (class.; cf.: findo, scindo, dirimo, segrego, secerno). </sense><sense id="n14536.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">res a natura copulatas audebit divellere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus, et undis spargere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:600" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 600</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agnam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:8:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 8, 27</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">suos artus lacero morsu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:878" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 878</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:9:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 3, 9, 27</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:865" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 865</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">magnos montes manibus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to cleave</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 202</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">mediam partem quercus (with discidere),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:16:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 16, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nodos manibus,</quote> <trans><tr>to untie</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:220" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paenulam sentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nubem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 203</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 122</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14536.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to tear violently apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sunder</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">commoda civium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:23:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 23, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem dissolutam divulsamque conglutinare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:41:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 41, 188</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 6, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">affinitas divelli nullo modo poterat,</quote> <trans><tr>to be dissolved</tr>, <tr>destroyed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 6, 25</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">amicitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 6</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">amorem querimoniis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:13:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 13, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">somnos (cura),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">distineor et divellor dolore,</quote> <trans><tr>am distracted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:33:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 33, 79</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14536.4" n="II" level="1"> (Like distraho, II.) <hi rend="ital">To tear away</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">remove</hi> from something (class.). </sense><sense id="n14536.5" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra divellere ac distrahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 20 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ab aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:10:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 10, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:chapter=36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">liberos a parentum complexu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 9</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: aliquem dulci amplexu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:568" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 568</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Damalin adultero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:36:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 36, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec me umquam Gyas (sc. a te),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 17, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14536.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sapientiam, temperantiam, a voluptate divellere ac distrahere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:16:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 16, 50</bibl></cit>. —So of persons, <hi rend="ital">to draw away</hi> from one in feeling, <hi rend="ital">to estrange</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui a me mei servatorem capitis divellat ac distrahat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:42:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 42, 102</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
divendo: <entryFree id="n14537" type="main" key="di_vendo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-vendo</orth>, no <sense id="n14537.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>dĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to sell piecemeal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in different parcels</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to retail</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">bona,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 1, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 53</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
diventilo: <entryFree id="n14538" type="main" key="di_venti^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-ventĭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n14538.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to spread abroad.</hi>—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">diventilatis in vulgus opinionibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
diverbero: <entryFree id="n14539" type="main" key="di_verbe^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-verbĕro</orth>, no <sense id="n14539.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf.</hi>, <itype>ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">to strike asunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cleave</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divide.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14539.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">res ictu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aërias undas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 151</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucres auras sagittā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:503" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 503</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umbras ferro,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 294</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">9, 411: fluctus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:4" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod jubis pronos cervix diverberet armos,</quote> <trans><tr>flaps</tr>, <tr>strikes</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nemes.</author> Cyn. 265</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14539.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to cudgel soundly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 7 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
diverbium: <entryFree id="n14540" type="greek" key="di_verbi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-verbĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>verbum</etym>, <sense id="n14540.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the colloquial part of a comedy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">the dialogue</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 64, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 489</bibl> P. al.—</sense><sense id="n14540.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a comedy.—Plur.</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 4, 61</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
divergium: <entryFree id="n14541" type="main" key="di_vergi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-vergĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>vergo</etym>, <sense id="n14541.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a point of separation</hi>: aquarum, <hi rend="ital">water-shed</hi>, Sic. Fl. p. 24 ed. Goes. al.; cf. divortium.</sense></entryFree>
diverro: <entryFree id="n14542" type="main" key="di_verro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-verro</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, v. deverro.</entryFree>
diverse: <entryFree id="n14543" type="main" key="di_verse"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīverse</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dīvorse</orth>), <pos>adv.</pos>, v. diverto, <sense id="n14543.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">P. a. fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
diversiclinia: <entryFree id="n14544" type="main" key="di_versi_^cli_ni^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīversī^clīnĭa</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>diversus + <foreign lang="greek">kli/nw</foreign></etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">e(tero/klita</foreign>, <sense id="n14544.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">words irregularly inflected</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 1065</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
diversicolor: <entryFree id="n14545" type="main" key="di_versi^co^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīversĭ-cŏlor</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dīvors-</orth>), <itype>ōris</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>diversus</etym>, <sense id="n14545.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of various colors</hi>, <hi rend="ital">party-colored</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">unda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">§ 67</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">metalla,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, § 811</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
diversicolorus: <entryFree id="n14546" type="main" key="di_versi^co^lo_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīversĭ-cŏlōrus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, collat. form of diversicolor, <sense id="n14546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">party-colored</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 1, § 74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
diversitas: <entryFree id="n14547" type="main" key="di_versi^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīversĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>diversus</etym> (postAug.; cf.: differentia, discrepantia, discrimen, varietas, variatio). <sense id="n14547.0" n="I" level="1"> (Acc. to diversus, I. B.) <hi rend="ital">Contrariety</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contradiction</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disagreement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mira diversitate naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter exercitum imperatoremque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1</bibl></cit>, <pb n="601" /> <cb n="DIVE" /> 62; cf. auctorum. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 26, 30, § 124</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:8" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter medicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 5, 20, § 42</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n14547.1" n="II" level="1"> (Acc. to diversus, II.) <hi rend="ital">Diversity</hi>, <hi rend="ital">difference</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tanta per omnes gentes nationesque linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:87" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ciborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multiplex personarum, causarum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:15:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 15, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingeniorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consiliorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 76</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">inter unciam et digitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 24" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 24</bibl></cit> et saep.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:10:6" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 10, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14547.2" n="III" level="1"> Concr., <hi rend="ital">a variety</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lignorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:31:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 31, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
diversorium: <entryFree id="n14548" type="main" key="di_verso_rium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīversōrium</orth>, v. deversorius.</entryFree>
diversus: <entryFree id="n14549" type="main" key="di_versus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīversus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, from diverto.</entryFree>
divertium: <entryFree id="n14550" type="main" key="di_vertium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvertium</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. divortium.</entryFree>
diverto: <entryFree id="n14551" type="main" key="di_verto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-verto</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">vorto</orth>), <itype>ti, sum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos>, <sense id="n14551.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to turn</hi> or <hi rend="ital">go different ways</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">turn aside</hi> (in the <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi> rare; not in the class. per.). </sense><sense id="n14551.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14551.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To turn out of the way;</hi> hence, of travellers, <hi rend="ital">to stop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lodge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sojourn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui divertebat in proximo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 7, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in cenaculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 4 Reg. 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hominem peccatorem,</quote> <trans><tr>to visit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:19:7 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 19, 7 al.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n14551.3" n="B" level="2"> Of a married woman, <hi rend="ital">to leave her husband</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(uxor) sive diverterit, sive nupta est adhuc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:27:section=30" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 27, § 30</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">so of divorce: si uxor a legato diverterit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:1:42" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 5, 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullis matrimoniis divertentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 3</bibl></cit>. V. also divortium.—</sense><sense id="n14551.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to deviate from each other</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to differ</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">divortunt mores virgini longe ac lupae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:3:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 3, 3, 22</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīversus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-vorsus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">turned different ways.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14551.5" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Set over against each other</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opposite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contrary</hi> (freq. and class.; cf.: adversus, contrarius). </sense><sense id="n14551.6" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in diversum iter equi concitati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fenestrae,</quote> <trans><tr>opposite each other</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:3:31" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 3, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">ripa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:264" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 264</bibl></cit> Drak.: <cit><quote lang="la">iter a proposito diversum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:69:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 69, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">diverso ab ea regione itinere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 41, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diversis ab flumine regionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 6, 25, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diversam aciem constituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:40:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 40, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo cinguli maxime inter se diversi, i. e. the two polar circles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 6, 20</bibl></cit> (13): <cit><quote lang="la">diversum ad mare dejectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 60</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">procurrentibus in diversa terris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in diversum flectere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 45, 101, § 248</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">binas per diversum coassationes substernere,</quote> <trans><tr>cross-wise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 25, 62, § 186</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14551.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14551.8" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">different</hi>, <hi rend="ital">diverse</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opposite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contrary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conflicting</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">varius, differens, discrepans, multiplex): monstrum ex contrariis diversisque inter se pugnantibus naturae studiis cupiditatibusque conflatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:chapter=5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quis non diversa praesentibus contrariaque expectatis aut speret aut timeat?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:75:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 75, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pessuma ac divorsa inter se mala, luxuria atque avaritia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 5, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 4</bibl>.—In the <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne illi falsi sunt, qui diversissimas res pariter exspectant, ignaviae voluptatem et praemia virtutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diversa sibi ambo consilia capiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:30:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 30, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est huic diversum vitio vitium prope majus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:80:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 80, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">initio reges diversi pars ingenium, alii corpus exercebant,</quote> <trans><tr>pursuing opposite courses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diversi imperatoribus (sc. Scipioni et Mummio) mores, diversa fuerunt studia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:13:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dividere bona diversis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 114</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:60" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 60 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> et saep.—Of conflicting passions: Pentheum diripuisse aiunt Bacchas; <cit><quote lang="la">nugas fuisse credo, prae quo pacto ego divorsus distrahor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:2:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Merc. 2, 4, 2</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">divorsius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:803" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 803</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14551.9" n="2" level="3"> In partic. (like contrarius, II. 2.), <hi rend="ital">inimically opposed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of hostile</hi> or <hi rend="ital">opposite opinions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unfriendly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hostile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">certa igitur cum illo, qui a te totus diversus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">regio ab se diversa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:32:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 32, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diversos iterum conjungere amantes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:10:15" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 57</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">14, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">factio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caes. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diversae partis advocatus,</quote> <trans><tr>opposite</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Gramm. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diversi ordiuntur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subsellia,</quote> <trans><tr>of the opponents</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:133" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 133</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">minuere invidiam aut in diversum eam transferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:64" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defectio Tarentinorum utrum priore anno an hoc facta sit, in diversum auctores trahunt,</quote> <trans><tr>are not agreed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo in diversum auctore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consistentis ex diverso patroni,</quote> <trans><tr>on the opposite side</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex diverso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 11, 43</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 16</bibl> et saep.; <cit><quote lang="la">also: e diverso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 4, 5, § 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:4:6" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 30, 4, 6</bibl>; the latter in Sueton, and the elder <cb n="DIVE" /> Pliny, i. q. contra, <hi rend="ital">on the contrary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt qui putent, etc. ... Alii e diverso, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:86" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 86</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 50, 51, § 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:56 al" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 9, 10, § 56 al.</bibl>; cf. Sillig. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 4, § 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:16" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 16</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n14551.10" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">In different directions</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apart</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi> (so most freq. in all periods and kinds of writing). </sense><sense id="n14551.11" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: dispennite hominem divorsum et distennite, <hi rend="ital">spread out in opposite directions</hi>, i. e. his limbs, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 5, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diversae state,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">diversi pugnabant,</quote> <trans><tr>separately</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:58:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 58, 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">jam antea diversi audistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 5</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">sive juncti unum premant, sive id diversi gerant bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diversi dissipatique in omnes partes fugere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 24, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex diversa fuga in unum collecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">age diversos et disice corpora ponto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diversi consules discedunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:33:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 33, 10</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:56" default="NO" valid="yes">22, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,014:11:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dat. 11, 3 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quo diversus abis?</quote> <trans><tr>away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 166</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">11, 855</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (portus) cum diversos inter se aditus habeant, in exitu conjunguntur et confluunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 52 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:32:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 32, 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in locis disjunctissimis maximeque diversis,</quote> <trans><tr>very widely separated</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 4</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">loca,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 22, 1</bibl> et saep.—Cf. in the <hi rend="ital">sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diversissimis locis subeundo ad moenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itinera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 16 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:67:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 67, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">proelium,</quote> <trans><tr>fought in different places</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:19:2" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 19, 2</bibl></cit> et saep.: sunt ea innumerabilia, quae a diversis emebantur, <hi rend="ital">by various people</hi>, <hi rend="ital">individuals</hi> (as an indefinite term for persons), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 37</bibl>. —<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, i. q. remotus, <hi rend="ital">remote</hi>, <hi rend="ital">far-distant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aesar,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>flowing in another</tr>, <tr>remote country</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 261</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 621</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">708: diverso terrarum distineri,</quote> <trans><tr>distance apart</tr>, <tr>remoteness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 59</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n14551.12" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14551.13" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Different</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unlike</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissimilar</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">varia et diversa genera et bellorum et hostium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> de Imp. Pomp. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">variae et diversae et diffusae disputationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:16:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 16, 61</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 61</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diversa ac dissimilis pars,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:23:33" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 23, 33</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">diversa studia in dissimili ratione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumina diversa locis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 367</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">oris habitu simili aut diverso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:34 al" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 3, 34 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut par ingenio, ita morum diversus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a proposita ratione diversum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:chapter=90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 90</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ab his longe diversae litterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 34 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:9" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 9</bibl>; cf. also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:10:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 10, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic diversa sententia eorum fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:32" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 6, 32</bibl></cit>. —Cf. so with <case>dat.</case>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:3:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:10:3" default="NO">3, 10, 3</bibl> et saep.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diversa omnium, quae umquam accidere, civilium armorum facies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diversa in hac ac supradicta alite quaedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 12, 15, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eruca diversae est, quam lactuca, naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 8, 44, § 154</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14551.14" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Divided</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fluctuating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hesitating</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inconsistent</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">metu ac libidine divorsus agebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 25, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui diversus animi modo numen pavescere, modo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diversi fremat inconstantia vulgi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:45" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 45</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-verse</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvorse</orth> (acc. to II.), <hi rend="ital">different ways</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hither and thither; in different directions</hi> (very rarely): corpora prostrata diverse jacebant, <hi rend="ital">scattered</hi>, Auct. B. Afr. 40 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">pauci paulo divorsius conciderant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 61:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 61, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multifariam diverseque tendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:19" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14551.15" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> of the mind: <cit><quote lang="la">curae meum animum divorse trahunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:1:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 1, 5, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab eodem de eadem re diverse dicitur,</quote> <trans><tr>differently</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:50" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diversissime adfici,</quote> <trans><tr>very variously</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:66" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uti verbo ab alicujus sententia diverse,</quote> <trans><tr>in a different meaning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:6:17:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 6, 17, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dives: <entryFree id="n14552" type="main" key="di_ves"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīves</orth>, <itype>ĭtis</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīs</orth>, <itype>dīte</itype> (v. seq. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>perh. root div-, gleam; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">di=os</foreign>; Lat. divus, dies</etym>, <sense id="n14552.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rich</hi> (cf.: pecuniosus, beatus, locuples, opulens, opulentus). </sense><sense id="n14552.1" n="I" level="1"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīves</orth> (class. and freq.; the <case>nom.</case> and <case>acc.</case> of the <hi rend="ital">neutr. plur.</hi> do not occur; cf. Neue Formenl. 2, 51, v. </sense><sense id="n14552.2" n="(b)" level="5"> infra; <hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi> usually divite, e. g. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 8, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:409" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 409</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:10:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 10, 53</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:95" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 95</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:23" default="NO">7, 4, 23</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">diviti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 1, 3, § 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:108" default="NO" valid="yes">7, 29, 30, § 108</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">ubi dives blande appellat pauperem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">opp. pauper,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 19</bibl></cit>; 49; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 56</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 4, 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 13</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">quem intelligimus divitem? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:1" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solos sapientes esse, si mendicissimi, divites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:chapter=29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 29 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so opp. mendici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:8:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 8, 3, 9</bibl></cit> et saep.: Crassus,<cb n="DIVI" />  cum cognomine dives tum copiis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:16:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 2, 16, 57</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Fufidius Dives agris, dives positis in fenore nummis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:421" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 421</bibl>; so with <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecore et multa tellure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:15:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Epod. 15, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquo censu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amico Hercule,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:5:3" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 5, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:3:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 44, 3, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44:1:7" default="NO">44, 1, 7</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">Liv. Praef. § 11: bubus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dote,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:11:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 11, 100</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">dives pecoris nivei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 20</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:468" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 468</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:570" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 570</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">armenti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 9, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equum pictae vestis et auri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:8:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 8, 5</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">dives ab omni armento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:204" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 204</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14552.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things. </sense><sense id="n14552.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Rich</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sumptuous</hi>, <hi rend="ital">costly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">splendid</hi>, <hi rend="ital">precious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus hominis dives, non arca appellari solet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:1:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 6, 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Capua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 224</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Anagnia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 684</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Achaia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 268</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:262" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 262</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 195</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mensae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 121</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:409" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. P. 409</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">templum donis dives,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Africa triumphis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 38</bibl></cit>: Mantua avis, id. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 201</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">terra amomo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:307" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 307</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">dives opis natura suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 74</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14552.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Abundant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">plentiful</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">dives copia fiendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Trist. 3, 1, 102</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">stipendia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:43:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 43, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
dis: <entryFree id="n14553" type="main" key="di_s4" n="II"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīs</orth>, <sense id="n14553.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> dite (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; <cit><quote lang="la">in prose very rare before the Aug. per.): dis quidem esses,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dite solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:296" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 296</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujus ditis aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 42</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ditis domus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:2:65" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 2, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diti placitura magistro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:2:5:35" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 2, 5, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ditem hostem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ditem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:3:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 3, 3, 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diti de pectore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:414" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 414</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in diti domo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 34, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patre diti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam estis maxume potentes, dites, fortunati, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 57</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">dites,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:78" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 78</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:6:13" default="NO">3, 6, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:673" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 673</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Persarum campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:25:10" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 3, 25, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delubra ditia donis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 77</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">opulenta ac ditia stipendia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora ditum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 649" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 649</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">for which: regem ditium Mycenarum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Grat. Act. 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ditibus indulgent epulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:5:187" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 5, 187</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ditibus promissis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:512" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 512</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14553.1" n="b" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14553.2" n="(a)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvĭ-tior</orth> (most freq. in prose and poetry, except Hor., v. seq. <foreign lang="greek">b</foreign>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 5, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 5, 2, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> Ph. 1, 1, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:17:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 17, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:16:58" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 16, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:48:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 48, 185</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:3:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 6, 3, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:16:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 16, 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:452 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 6, 452 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14553.3" n="(b)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dītior</orth>, Liv. Praef. § 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 5, 91</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 9, 51</bibl>; 2, 7, 52; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:13:684" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 13, 684</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:481" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 481</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:1:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 1, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14553.4" n="c" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14553.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvĭtissi-mus</orth> (good prose), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:36" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 36</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:2:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 6, 2, 48</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phoc. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 2:9:7" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 2, 9, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:4:24" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 4, 24</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14553.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dītissimus</orth> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 136</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:343" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 343</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 537</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 360</bibl>; 10, 563; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 129</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:123" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 123</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:3:397" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 3, 397</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 54</bibl> (twice); * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:17:14" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:46" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 9</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">dītĭus</orth>, <hi rend="ital">more richly</hi> or <hi rend="ital">splendidly</hi> (post-Aug. and very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">ditius habitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:5:31" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 5, 31</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ditissime domos exornare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 54, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
divexo: <entryFree id="n14554" type="main" key="di_vexo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-vexo</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, <sense id="n14554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to pull</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rend asunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to destroy</hi> (very rare). </sense><sense id="n14554.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: neu reliquias sic meas sieris ... foede divexarier, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:44:106" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 44, 106</bibl> (Trag. v. 201 Rib.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnia divexare et diripere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agros civium optimorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 9</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">meam rem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14554.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to vex</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trouble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">matrem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:34" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 34</bibl></cit> (perhaps also clientelas, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 3</bibl>, v. Baumg.-Crus. in h. l.).</sense></entryFree>
divexus: <entryFree id="n14555" type="hapax" key="di_vexus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvexus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>veho</etym>, <sense id="n14555.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">spread out</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Conf. 10:34" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Conf. 10, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
divico: <entryFree id="n14556" type="main" key="Divi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Divĭco</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n14556.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a distinguished Helvetian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a general in the war against Cassius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and ambassador to Caesar</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 13, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 14, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
dividia: <entryFree id="n14557" type="main" key="di_vi^di^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvĭdĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>dividus</etym> (ante-class.; most freq. in Plaut.; not found in Ter.), <sense id="n14557.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">division;</hi> hence trop., </sense><sense id="n14557.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Dissension</hi>, <hi rend="ital">discord</hi>: ne horum dividiae et discordiae dissipent divitias, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 101, 20</bibl> (R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Trag. Fragm. p. 212</bibl>; cf.: dissensiones, Non.); cf.: dividiam discordiam, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=70:15" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 70, 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14557.2" n="II" level="1"> (Like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">me/rimna</foreign>, from <foreign lang="greek">meri/s, meri/zw</foreign>, to divide, qs.: affectus animum dividens diverseque trahens; cf. Ter. <pb n="602" /> <cb n="DIVI" /> And. 1, 5, 25; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 285</bibl>.) <hi rend="ital">Care</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trouble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disquiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vexation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dividia ab dividendo dicta, quod divisio distractio est doloris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:60" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, 60</bibl></cit> M.: dividias mentis conficit omnis amor, Poëta ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> 564, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam quod tibi est Aegre, idem mihi est dividiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 2, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 6, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 1, 1, 19</bibl> (with senio, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 96, 23</bibl>; R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Com. Fragm. p. 92</bibl>); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 4, 3</bibl>: hujus me dividia cogit plus quam est par loqui, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 96, 21</bibl> (R<bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> Trag. Fragm. p. 155</bibl>): dividia est taedium, Non. ib.</sense></entryFree>
dividicula: <entryFree id="n14558" type="gloss" key="di_vi^di^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvĭdĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>antiqui dicebant, quae nunc sunt castella, ex quibus a rivo communi aquam quisque in suum fundum ducit</itype>, <sense id="n14558.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">reservoirs</hi>, <hi rend="ital">water-works</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=70:12" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 70, 12</bibl> Müll. [divido].</sense></entryFree>
divido: <entryFree id="n14559" type="main" key="di_vi^do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">dī-vĭdo</orth>, <itype>vīsi, vīsum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n14559.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">perf. sync.</hi> divisse, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 169</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>root vidh-, to part, split; Sanscr. vidhyati, to penetrate, whence vidhava; Lat. vidua</etym>. </sense><sense id="n14559.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To force asunder</hi>, <hi rend="ital">part</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">divide</hi> (very freq. and class.; cf.: distribuo, dispertio; findo, scindo, dirimo, divello, separo, sejungo, segrego, secerno). </sense><sense id="n14559.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: Europam Libyamque rapax ubi dividit unda, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:20" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 20</bibl>; and <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:10" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">discludere mundum membraque dividere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:440" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 440</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">si omne animal secari ac dividi potest, nullum est eorum individuum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crassum aërem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 19 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit> (with perrumpere); cf. <cit><quote lang="la">nubila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:34:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 34, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">muros,</quote> <trans><tr>to break through</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 234</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmor cuneis,</quote> <trans><tr>to split</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 5, 4, § 14</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc medium securi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mediam frontem ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:751" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 751</bibl></cit>; also simply, insulam, for <hi rend="ital">to divide into two parts</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 6</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vagam caelo volucrem,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to cleave</tr>, <tr>to shoot</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:2:90" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 2, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol ... in partes non aequas dividit orbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:683" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 683</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so Galliam in partes tres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicum in duas partes flumine,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatem Helvetiam in quatuor pagos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populum unum in duas partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:32:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 32, 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:35:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 35, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">divisi in factiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 20</bibl></cit> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n14559.3" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14559.4" n="a" level="4"> For distribuere, <hi rend="ital">to divide among several</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to distribute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apportion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">argentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Aul. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecudes et agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1109</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">agros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrum viritim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:14:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 14, 57</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bona viritim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:20:48" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 20, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">munera, vestem, aurum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 7</bibl></cit> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">nummos in viros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 2, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Thracia in Rhoemetalcen inque liberos Cotyis dividitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 67</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 38</bibl>. So of distributing troops in any place: <cit><quote lang="la">equitatum in omnes partes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:43:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 43, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum omnem passim in civitates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 3 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanos in custodiam civitatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 43, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 45 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: conjuratos municipatim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agros viritim civibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 14</bibl></cit>;
