so with <case>dat.</case> (most freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">agrum sordidissimo cuique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 47</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:20" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 20</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">tabellas toti Italiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:chapter=15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedam militibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 91:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 91, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca praefectis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duo praedia natis duobus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oscula nulli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:36:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 1, 36, 6</bibl></cit> et saep.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in double construction: divisit in singulos milites trecenos aeris, duplex centurionibus, triplex equiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter participes praedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 1, 5</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">inter se,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 3, 5, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Thras. 1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Thras. 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">per populum fumantia (liba),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:672" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 672</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">agros per veteranos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dimidiam partem cum aliquo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:10:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 10, 37</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:5:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 5, 1, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praemia mecum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:887" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 887</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non divides (with dispertire),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:102 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 102 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n14559.5" n="b" level="4"> In mercant. lang. like distrahere and divendere, <hi rend="ital">to sell piecemeal</hi>, <hi rend="ital">in parcels</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to retail</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:54" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14559.6" n="c" level="4"> In mal. part., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 4, 4</bibl> Wagner; 7; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 11</bibl> Büch.—</sense><sense id="n14559.7" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n14559.8" n="1" level="3"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">bona tripartito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:13" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annum ex aequo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:565" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 565</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horas (bucina),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:689" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 689</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempora curarum remissionumque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dignitatem ordinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 13, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et explanare ambigua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:chapter=32" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">idem genus universum in species certas partietur et dividet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 33, 117</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">of logical or rhet. division,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:9:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 9, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:6:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 6, 37</bibl> et saep.: verba, <hi rend="ital">to divide<cb n="DIVI" />  at the end of the line</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:87" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos alio mentes, alio divisimus aures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:62:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 62, 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">animum nunc huc celerem, nunc dividit illuc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 285</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14559.9" n="2" level="3"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n14559.10" n="a" level="4"> Sententiam, polit. t. t., <hi rend="ital">to divide the question</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to take the vote separately upon the several parts of a motion</hi> or <hi rend="ital">proposition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">divisa sententia est postulante nescio quo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 6, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 14, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 21" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. Beat. 3</bibl>. The expression used in requiring this was DIVIDE, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0803,001:Cic. Mil. 6:14" default="NO"><author>Ascon.</author> Cic. Mil. 6, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14559.11" n="b" level="4"> (Acc. to A. 2. a.) <hi rend="ital">To distribute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apportion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic belli rationem esse divisam, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:17:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 17, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec temporibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 1, 18</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">Just. Praef. § 3: ea (negotia) divisa hoc modo dicebantur, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 43:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 43, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14559.12" n="c" level="4"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to break up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dissolve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destroy</hi> = dissolvere: <cit><quote lang="la">nostrum concentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 14, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ira fuit capitalis ut ultima divideret mors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 1, 7, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dividitur ferro regnum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 109</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dividimus muros, et moenia pandimus urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 234</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n14559.13" n="d" level="4"> <hi rend="ital">To accompany</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to share</hi> upon an instrument a song sung by a voice: <cit><quote lang="la">grata feminis Imbelli cithara carmina divides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 15, 15</bibl></cit>.</sense><sense id="n14559.14" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To divide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">part from; to remove from</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n14559.15" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen Rhenus agrum Helvetium a Germanis dividit ... flumen Rhodanus provinciam nostram ab Helvetiis dividit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 8, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 11, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Macedoniam a Thessalia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:36:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 36, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallos ab Aquitanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:1:2 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. G. 1, 1, 2 al.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tota cervice desecta, divisa a corpore capita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:34:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 34, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populum distribuit in quinque classes, senioresque a junioribus divisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tam multa illa meo divisast milia lecto, Quantum, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:12:3" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 12, 3</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dextras miseris complexibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:166" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 166</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuis toto dividor orbe rogis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Pont. 1, 9, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dividor (sc.: ab uxore) haud aliter, quam si mea membra relinquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:3:73" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 3, 73</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:12:10" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 12, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Italiam) Longa procul longis via dividit invia terris,</quote> <trans><tr>separates</tr>, <tr>keeps distant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:383" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 383</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 45</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">discedite a contactu ac dividite turbidos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 43 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n14559.16" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to separate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distinguish</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legem bonam a mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:16:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 16, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">defensionem (opp. se comitem exitii promittebat),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 15</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n14559.17" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, for distinguere (II.), <hi rend="ital">to distinguish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decorate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">adorn</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">qualis gemma micat, fulvum quae dividit aurum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 134</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scutulis dividere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:196" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 48, 74, § 196</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvīsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">divided</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">divisior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:962" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 962</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi> </sense><sense id="n14559.18" n="(a)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvīse</orth>, <hi rend="ital">distinctly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">separately</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:22:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 22, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:7:2" default="NO">7, 2</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Carn. Chr. 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n14559.19" n="(b)" level="5"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">dīvīsim</orth>, <hi rend="ital">separately</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 100, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
